kuvaus.en: The Degree Programme in Talent Management prepares graduates for business by providing a comprehensive understanding of people-oriented leadership, business management, and entrepreneurship. This international programme integrates sustainability and diversity throughout studies to prepare students for their chosen career paths.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Business Administration (UAS), Economics, Administration and Marketing
Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA), Business and Talent Development, Lapland UAS

kuvaus.en:
What competence does the graduate have?

BBA’s degree in Business Information Technology offers core competences in Information Technology, Business, and Project Management. During the studies, students achieve knowledge and abilities in ICT environments, service development, programming, databases, networks, communication technologies and information security. Additionally, the degree provides skills for project work, communication, business operations and entrepreneurship. Universities of Applied Sciences offer different specialization studies for the BBA’s degree in Business Information Technology. Specialization options can be found on the websites of Universities of Applied Sciences.

What kind of learning methods are used in the education?

Universities of Applied Sciences work in close co-operation with business and industry partners, which enables students to participate in different kinds of working life projects during the studies. Complementing conventional campus based teaching, various other modern teaching methodologies are used, such as online and project based learning. Diverse pedagogical methods make studies flexible and suitable for students with different backgrounds (e.g. for students, who are already in working life).

What kind of career opportunities does the graduate have?

Graduates from BBA’s degree in Business Information Technology are employed in various managerial, consultative and specialist roles in business and industry. Typical job roles are Project Manager, Service Manager, System Administrator, Digital Media Specialist, Digital Consultant, Security Consultant, Developer, Web Designer, Game Designer, Technical Support Specialist, Network Operations Specialist and Systems Security Analyst. Graduates can also work as entrepreneurs. The work life roles are dependent on selected specialization studies and student’s individual interest.

You can find more information about BBA’s degree in Business Information Technology on the websites of Universities of Applied Sciences and on Studyinfo.fi.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Business Administration (UAS), Data Processing
Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA), Business Information Technology

kuvaus.en:
Are you interested in Sport? Do you want to work within an international business environment? Would you like to combine your passion for sport and business to create a pathway to a job you love?

In Lapland and internationally the sports industry is flourishing, and there is a constant need for a workforce equipped with up-to-date skills and resources to keep the industry sprinting forward. As an international education, we challenge students to consider cultural and communication elements throughout their studies in preparation for their future career paths.

Once graduated you can start to look forward to a career in sports business and management. As an expert in several subjects moving into the workplace or establishing your own business will come naturally as your next challenge. The Arctic is a perfect location to develop your skills. Lapland is a region of sporting excellence, and we are ready to help build you to be your greatest self.

Implementation of studies may take multiple forms: in-class studies as well as field activities such as practical training in a company and field trips in the region, events related to working life, an international exchange period and online studies.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Business Administration (UAS), Economics, Administration and Marketing
Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA), International Sport Business Management, Lapland UAS

kuvaus.en:
Safety, Security and Risk management contribute greatly to the success of businesses, both nationally and internationally. As a Bachelor of Business Administration specialising in safety, security, and risk management you will have some opportunities for employment and career.

What competence does the graduate have?

At Laurea’s Leppävaara campus you can study to become a professional in the field of Safety, Security and Risk Management. With us, you will learn to develop innovative solutions and use diverse development methods throughout your studies. The Degree Programme in Safety, Security and Risk Management enables students to acquire a high level of integrity and critical understanding of risk management, and the ability to apply this knowledge in organizations in both private and public sectors. Students may also participate in work-life projects, which is a great way to network and learn in an authentic environment. Many students find work placements or even begin their careers through these projects.


What kind of learning methods are used? 

The Safety, Security and Risk Management studies are implemented as blended learning studies.

On-campus and online studies are combined in Laurea's blended learning studying. Studying requires self-direction, group and networking skills, and the ability to schedule studies to fit one's life. Although blended learning focuses on online and remote teaching, it also includes on-campus teaching and scheduled online meetings with mandatory attendance. Blended learning studying is full-time, so sufficient time must be allocated for studies. The studies also include internships, which, if possible, take place in the student's hometown or nearby areas. The internships are full-time and require attendance. 

What kind of career opportunities does the graduate have?

After your graduation, your possibilities in the job market will be diverse: you could find a job in a private sector company, in local or national government, and other public sector actors, or in the third sector including NGOs. You may also become an entrepreneur, and you can even start your entrepreneurial activities while still a student. 

Graduates of the Safety, Security and Risk Management degree programme will have job opportunities in several sectors, and they will be eligible for a great variety of roles. Possible job titles include: 

  • risk manager
  • security manager
  • project manager
  • facility manager
  • security specialist
  • security planning officer
  • information and/or cyber security expert
  • event safety expert
  • health, safety and environment manager
  • head of security
  • manager in a private security company
  • fire inspector
  • security sector instructor
  • other related supervisory, managerial and specialist titles.
  • entrepreneur

nimi.en: Bachelor of Business Administration (UAS), Security Management
Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA), Safety, Security and Risk Management

kuvaus.en:
The Bachelor’s Degree Programme in Business Information Technology trains you to become a specialist of digital solutions and digitalization in businesses. The programme gives you a new perspective on how information technology can be integrated with business processes, and how digitalization can improve business productivity.

Combination of Business and Technology

The programme combines theory and practice and equips you for a range of roles in the Business Information Technology field. The programme prepares students for digital business expert roles. You will also gain skills and knowledge to continue your studies further towards a master’s degree.

Upon successful completion of this programme, you will have a comprehensive understanding of future-oriented, innovative business operations. You will be able to automate business and implement service chains with the latest technologies while taking into account customer needs. You will have a command of agile and flexible methods and the ability to organise and lead projects based on analysed information. The programme also gives you the expertise needed to work as an entrepreneur.

The programme is taught in English. In addition, we offer you opportunities to study foreign languages. If your mother tongue is other than Finnish, you have a perfect chance to study Finnish in different ways with us.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Business Administration (UAS), Data Processing
Bachelor of Business Administration, Business Information Technology, Lahti Campus

kuvaus.en:
Learning by doing business together

In TAMK Proakatemia, you will gain a vantage point to global team entrepreneurship and leadership within a community based on advanced Finnish team learning and coaching model.

You will learn valuable real-life entrepreneurial and leadership skills, project management, communication skills, to evaluate and innovate different business ideas and models, systems thinking, digital business skills and, most importantly, how to run and develop a business that is successful, sustainable and responsible.

Our team leadership ideology introduces a truly Finnish concept of team learning and coaching model. Studying in Proakatemia takes place by working in a team enterprise together with other team entrepreneur students. Team entrepreneurs establish real enterprises in which they learn teamwork, management, and other entrepreneurial skills by combining theory and practice. Coaches facilitate this by guiding towards new innovations and by setting learning goals in accordance to the underlying curriculum.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Business Administration (UAS), Economics, Administration and Marketing
Bachelor of Business Administration, Entrepreneurship and Team Leadership

kuvaus.en:
Objective of the studies is to make you a versatile professional in international business:

* you are able to handle all necessary operations along the international supply chain

* you are creative and innovative in designing services for international businesses

* you are competent is working in multicultural teams and global networks

* you have the necessary tools for solving problems and communicating the solutions.

Our International Business programme will prepare you to work on a broad scale of tasks in international companies. You will be able to handle all necessary operations along the supply chain from raw material supplier to the final consumer.

After the graduation you will be well equipped for an exciting career in an international company abroad or in Finland - or for possible further studies towards a master’s degree, which ever you choose.

The programme provides you with an inspiring and challenging way to learn by doing. You will work in international teams with your fellow students on real-life cases. Your information acquiring, and communication skills will evolve, and you will develop your problem-solving skills within multi-cultural teams and networks.

Besides the Finns, in a typical year, 40 – 60% of the students of our programme come from various cultures around the world. In addition, Satakunta University of Applied Sciences welcomes also a lot of exchange students each year. Thus, during your studies, we can guarantee multicultural exposure at home as well as through a wide range of opportunities for a study or working period abroad. All this prepares you towards becoming a truly global professional!

nimi.en: Bachelor of Business Administration (UAS), Economics, Administration and Marketing
Bachelor of Business Administration, International Business
Satakunta University of Applied Sciences SAMK

kuvaus.en:
The Arcada Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) TopUp with a specialization in Tourism and the Experience Industry is a dynamic and intensive program designed for individuals passionate about tourism, hospitality, and the experience industry, with a focus on the unique opportunities and challenges of working in the Nordic region.  

This BBA TopUp from Arcada UAS offers a unique opportunity to build upon your existing BBA knowledge while specialising in Nordic Tourism and the Experience Industry. Core business administration courses in finance, marketing, management, and entrepreneurship are accredited from your previous studies, allowing you to focus on advanced courses tailored to the tourism and hospitality sectors.  

Applicants with a bachelor's degree in business, tourism or Hospitality Management or a Diploma in Tourism and Hospitality and a minimum of three years of studies can apply to the TopUp Program. 

The Nordic Tourism TopUp programme results in a Finnish Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) worth 210 ECTS.  It is designed to be completed in 1-2 years, depending on the accreditation of previous studies and the pace of study. Studies are designed so that it is possible to combine studying and working.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Business Administration (UAS), Economics, Administration and Marketing
Bachelor of Business Administration, Nordic Tourism and the Experience Industry TopUp

kuvaus.en: The training qualifies the person to act as a lead site manager in construction work in accordance with the Act on Demonstration of Competence. After completing the education, the construction foreman can plan and manage a construction site, and act as a supervisor for construction professionals. The site manager can work in cooperation with other parties in a construction project.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Construction Management, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en: The Fine Arts degree program equips you with the skills to undertake artistic commissions and projects. The curriculum emphasizes the development of your individual creative thinking and artistic practice. We embrace the diverse possibilities within contemporary art and encourage you to cultivate an experimental approach. The program focuses on contemporary art and its myriad expressions and techniques. Our hybrid model ensures that you receive personalized guidance and support, tailored to your individual artistic journey. Students train to develop strong professional presentation skills, enabling them to confidently showcase their work in various settings, from museum and gallery exhibitions, academic conferences to client meetings.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Culture and Arts (UAS), Visual Artist
Bachelor of Culture and Arts, Fine Arts

kuvaus.en:
An artist needs versatile knowledge and skills to practice and develop his/her profession. Studies in the degree programme in Fine Arts assure the basis for skills and knowledge needed when working as a free artist. Society needs artists to maintain the basis for intellectual culture. Artistic creativity is the core of all artistic work but it also enables creating an atmosphere that encourages creativity for the whole society. Creativity is an enabler for several new working duties.

Artists work as special experts in the continuously expanding visual field. They possess a special skill to articulate by means of pictures and yield significance to our intellectual cultural heritage and participate in critical discussion. Art has a duty to maintain mental well-being and increase social interaction and empathy. In addition, artists benefit from developing their communication competence and co-operative skills, which make multi-professional teamwork possible. Creative competence has also potential in developing novel working duties. Success in the work of a free artist requires constant reaction to the continuously changing operating environment but also being able to proactively change the field of Fine Arts oneself.

The degree programme in Fine Arts includes both alternative professional studies (Sculpture, Painting, Graphics, Performance Art) and common basic studies. Common basic studies include theoretical subjects and a guided control of an artistic process in an annual Fine Arts seminar. Special attention is also paid to the artists´ project competence, working life skills and economic competence.

Based on the basic skills acquired during the first academic year, the students choose professional studies from the beginning of the second academic year. The second and third year students can choose between two or three simultaneous study units. Each student can acquire artistic competence suitable to him/her and to meet his/her personal goals. More study units are allocated to study the techniques in Painting and Sculpture than to Graphics and Performance Art.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Culture and Arts (UAS), Visual Artist
Bachelor of Culture and Arts, Fine Arts

kuvaus.en:
Our programme, Bachelor of Culture and Arts in Game Arts provides students with the artistic and technical expertise needed to create compelling visual content for games. The program emphasizes concept art, 2D and 3D graphics, animation, character and environment design, to advanced game engines, programming, and project-based production. 

Students gain a comprehensive understanding of design principles, game mechanics, and interactive storytelling, combining technical proficiency with creative expression. 

Entrepreneurial skills are also developed, enabling students to recognize business opportunities, design creative strategies, and manage independent projects within the games industry. Learning is hands-on and project-based, with a strong emphasis on teamwork, preparing students for real industry collaboration or for an independent start-up career. 

Sustainability is a central theme throughout the studies. Students develop awareness of environmental and social responsibility in game production, and learn how to apply sustainable and inclusive approaches that contribute to the green transition of the industry.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Culture and Arts (UAS), Visual Artist
Bachelor of Culture and Arts, Game Arts
Bachelor of Culture and Arts (UAS), Musician
Bachelor of Culture and Arts, Musician, Double Degree

kuvaus.en:
What competences does the graduate have?

The contemporary world is growing ever more environmentally conscious and technology advances with huge leaps every day. It is important that you as designer understand the importance of sustainable values and the challenges of circular economy. You will learn how to use and combine both traditional and modern techniques with design thinking and a strong creative and material-based mindset.

There is need for the service and user experience design, where social media competence, marketing expertise and visualization expertise are combined with designer competence.

In our design education you can specialize in fashion, footwear and glass and ceramics design. After studies you will master all the steps from product design to manufacturing.

The studies offer versatile practical design skills. You will learn to manage customer-oriented and user-oriented design processes that apply

  • design thinking and culture
  • design methods
  • industry-specific materials and manufacturing methods
  • business perspectives and entrepreneurial activities
  • principles of sustainable and smart design
  • digital design methods and technologies
  • project competence

What kind of learning methods are used in the programme?

Studies are implemented in the field-specific design learning environments at Hämeenlinna University Centre. You study in design studio environments, where you learn how to apply theory in practice – through doing and making. Design studies are orientated towards working life and students have the opportunity to cooperate with companies in their field in various kinds of projects.

What kind of career opportunities does the graduate have?

Studies are implemented in the field-specific design learning environments at Hämeenlinna University Centre. You study in design studio environments, where you learn how to apply theory in practice – through doing and making. Design studies are orientated towards working life and students have the opportunity to cooperate with companies in their field in various kinds of projects.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Culture and Arts (UAS), Crafts and Design
Bachelor of Culture and Arts, Smart and Sustainable Design

kuvaus.en:
Become an Expert in XR Design

As an XR Design student, you will learn to create innovative applications and content for virtual and augmented reality environments. You will design spaces, concepts, objects, interfaces and immersive experiences for virtual environments using 3D modelling software and game engines as your tools.

Studying XR Design in a truly multicultural environment in Metropolia UAS gives you a perfect start towards an international career in a challenging and fast developing field of extended reality application design. The degree gives you a solid basis to work for example as an XR Designer, developer, digital artist, or project manager anywhere in the world.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Culture and Arts (UAS), Designer
Bachelor of Culture and Arts, XR Design, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en:
AI is shaking the field of technology as we speak. In addition to its impact on the future, it already has a significant impact on our everyday life. The demand for AI specialists with hands-on experience and a deep understanding of these tools that can harness the power of AI in different usage scenarios is growing substantially. Will you be the next AI specialist?

The programme

Luckily, today, AI is in the form of tools and libraries that don't require a scientific background to use. The Artificial Intelligence (Data Engineering) degree programme prepares you to utilize AI, programming, and data science in practical ways. During your studies, you will also gain additional skills in areas like entrepreneurship, project management, international collaboration, and working as part of multidisciplinary teams.

You can read more about the studies in the programme in the curriculum.

Studies take place on campus

Studies are conducted during daytime generally Monday-Friday as contact teaching on SAMK campus in Pori. Studying requires full-time studying and presence on our campus.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering (UAS), robotisation and artificial intelligence
Bachelor of Engineering, Artificial Intelligence (Data Engineering)
Satakunta University of Applied Sciences SAMK

kuvaus.en:
Consider an engineering degree in biotechnology if you are enthusiastic about technology, innovation and sustainable development!

In this field, you can get involved in developing new products that are more environmentally friendly than plastic and cotton. You can work in an industry that uses biomass to create sustainable solutions. Biotechnology offers the chance to create an exciting and meaningful career.

nimi.en: South-Eastern Finland University of Applied Sciences Xamk

kuvaus.en:
What competencies does the graduate have?

In addition to studies in mathematical and natural sciences, a student will acquire competencies and skills related to construction, structural engineering, project management, and financial thinking. The major part of studies consists of construction engineering and structural design. Improving energy efficiency and using business information modeling (BIM) in managing the lifecycle of the built environment are important future challenges to be resolved. Acknowledging sustainable development is also a substantial part of the construction profession now and in the future.

What kind of learning methods are used in the programme?

Studies are practical-oriented and meet the skills requirements derived from the working life. Theoretical learning is enhanced and put into practice through laboratory exercises and in authentic construction sites. Study methods include class-based learning, team and project work, and online learning. Studies include elective study modules, work placement, and final thesis. Work placement periods enable a student to meet personal learning objectives according to an area of interest in the field. The student can also undertake student exchange as part of the degree studies.

What kind of career opportunities does the graduate have?

The construction field offers a variety of career opportunities in new construction, renovation, planning, design, and sales and product development. One main area of work is also in using and maintenance of the real estate. In the construction branch, graduates work for example in designing and planning residential, commercial, and industrial buildings, work management of construction, maintenance, and renovation. Graduates are also employed by engineering and planning offices, construction companies, the building industry, and the public sector. Working in property real estate maintenance companies is also increasing as one possible career option in the field.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering (UAS), Building Construction, Community Development

kuvaus.en: Urgent demand for new energy sources and scarce natural resources, the pressure of population as well as increasing needs for waste management, are major challenges for nations and municipalities all over the world. Environmental issues are nowadays considered a megatrend and business activities in connection to energy and the environment are developing rapidly. To meet these challenges industrial companies, authorities and organisations need engineers that can grasp their assignments in a holistic way. These engineers need to have the required technical competence as well as a capability to consider the economical, legislative and social aspects.

Alternative energy sources, smarter powerplants and enviromental protection

Energy Technology Degree is for you if you want to affect in your work what energy will run the world in the future. As an Energy Technology Engineer, versatile and interesting tasks await you: Projects related to energy production in Finland and around the world need people who have a heart in place, but who also understand the technical side of things. The energy sector is a major employer in Vaasa and Finland. Jobs can also be found in the public sector.

Already during your studies, you get to do energy projects in cooperation with international companies. You will get to know the local business and industry, for example by visiting companies and construction sites, and creating new, valuable acquaintances with a view to working life. Also during the internship and thesis included in the Bachelor Degree study, you will get a good idea of the ​​futures work assignments and you get to open the doors into interesting companies.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering, Energy Technology, VAMK

kuvaus.en:
The programme in Information Technology is designed to provide the students with a comprehensive competence to master the IT industry’s newest and most important technologies. During the studies the students develop a professional way of understanding information technology and how technology is used today.

The studies aim at building the student’s competence and to create a professional identity. The advanced professional studies focus on programming and the concept of DevOps. DevOps is a method that combines programming and software development into a continuous process.

What competencies does the graduate have?

The curriculum in Information Technology Degree Program aims at educating qualified ICT engineers, with skills required in international careers. Information Technology degree programs develop students’ professional skills in a wide range of technologies needed in working life. These skills include, for example, software engineering, programming, database planning and management, web and mobile technologies, embedded systems, cloud and system architectures as well as user experience and user interfaces.

Universities of applied sciences have different profiles in their Information Technology degree programs. Professional competencies include, for example, software engineering, communication technology, mobile solutions, health technology, media engineering, and smart IoT systems.

What kind of learning methods are used in the program?

Studies are practical and meet the skills needs in working life. Various projects, practical assignments and laboratory work play a major role in learning. Studies also focus on building the so called soft-skills such as team working skills. Students can individually focus their studies on interesting subjects and deepen their skills during practical work placement.

What kind of career opportunities does the graduate have?

A graduate of information technology typically works in private or public sector, for example as a software developer or ICT expert in software development team, as a research engineer in product development designing systems with embedded intelligence, a solutions engineer designing networks, a cybersecurity solutions specialist or as a specialist in technical support, in customer service or in technical sales.

Read more about the Information Technology, Bachelor&#x27;s degree programme on Metropolia&#x27;s website

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering, Information Technology, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en:
The curriculum in Information Technology Degree Programme aims at educating qualified ICT engineers, with skills required in international careers. Information Technology degree programmes develop students’ professional skills in a wide range of technologies needed in working life. These skills include, for example, software engineering, programming, database planning and management, web and mobile technologies, embedded systems, cloud and system architectures as well as user experience and user interfaces.

Universities of applied sciences have different profiles in their Information Technology degree programmes. Professional competencies include, for example, software engineering, communication technology, mobile solutions, health technology, media engineering, and smart IoT systems.

Studies are practical and meet the skills needs in working life. Various projects, practical assignments and laboratory work play a major role in learning. Studies also focus on building the so called soft-skills such as team working skills. Students can individually focus their studies on interesting subjects and deepen their skills during practical work placement.

A graduate of information technology typically works in private or public sector, for example as a software developer or ICT expert in software development team, as a research engineer in product development designing systems with embedded intelligence, a solutions engineer designing networks, a cybersecurity solutions specialist or as a specialist in technical support, in customer service or in technical sales.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering, Information Technology, VAMK (B.Eng)

kuvaus.en:
The recent global crises have challenged the national and international supply chains. The need for logistics professionals with excellent multidisciplinary skills in innovation, adaptability and logistics knowledge is greater than ever. Supply chain data and resilience management will be the core business in the near future and our international logistics engineering degree program is designed to answer to these needs.

SAMK's logistics engineering program consists of basic engineering skills and knowledge of material, money and information flows along the supply chain management. The main focus is on sales and operations planning (S&OP), smart data analytics, transportation and maritime logistics.

The students graduating from Satakunta University of Applied Sciences logistics degree program will have the most versatile expertise in logistics to cover as well physical movements as data transfer.

nimi.en: Satakunta University of Applied Sciences SAMK

kuvaus.en:
This Bachelor’s programme offers a strong focus on machine learning and data engineering, preparing students to meet the growing demand for AI specialists skilled in data-driven technologies. Machine learning is at the core of the AI revolution, and this programme equips students with the practical skills to manage, analyze, and leverage data for intelligent solutions. Students will develop these skills through targeted coursework influenced by co-operation with local and international businesses in programming and development environments.

Programme stands out for its hands-on, practical approach to machine learning and data applications. You will dive straight into the tools, techniques, and skills demanded by today’s job market, working on real-world projects that mirror the challenges of the industry. Lapland UAS offers a community where students benefit from personalized interaction with faculty who are deeply invested in each student’s development. This supportive environment ensures that students are well-prepared, industry-ready experts.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering, Machine Learning and Data Engineering, Lapland UAS

kuvaus.en: Nowadays, the choice of sustainable materials is inevitable in product design and development. A sustainable way of thinking is needed to enhance our ecosystem, conserve natural resources and fight climate change. One of the main goals of the bachelor's degree programme Mechanical and Sustainable Engineering at Arcada is to strengthen your multidisciplinary competencies to develop sustainable solutions. The world needs innovative engineering approaches that tackle global challenges imposed by traditional approaches in engineering. As an engineering student at Arcada, you can make a difference.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering, Mechanical and Sustainable Engineering

kuvaus.en:
The degree programme in Mechanical Engineering gives you in-depth knowledge of the operation and design of mechanical equipment, project work and management, manufacturing methods, production and materials. Together, these form a solid foundation for a mechanical engineering specialist.

At SAMK you will learn to combine theory with practice. Studies progress from basic studies to professional studies and end with advanced professional studies and a thesis. They also provide a good basis for further studies. Field-specific practical training adds to your competence and helps you become a specialist in your field.

 

Your studies will include:

- Basic studies (e.g. mathematics, physics, communication, project work)

- Professional studies (e.g. technical drawing, 3D modelling, product development, materials engineering, mechanics, production control, project skills)

- Elective studies to add to your competence according to your interests

- Practical training and a bachelor’s thesis

- The studies are implemented bilingually in a multicultural group of students in close cooperation with working life. The language of tuition is English, with support also available in Finnish.

You will learn:

- Skills required in mechanical engineering from basic to advanced skills

- Production control skills

- Project management skills

- Accountability for your actions

What do you find intriguing? Is it the evolving world of technology and the endless possibilities to create a better future? The Mechatronics specialization in engineering provides you with in-depth knowledge of structures for devices, equipment and systems, which are essential part of our modern lives. Mechatronics engineering is a multidisciplinary branch focusing traditionally on the engineering of both electrical and mechanical systems. The focus in our degree programme is on machine automation. The modern concept of mechatronics includes a combination of automation, robotics, smart operating devices, and hardware-oriented programming as well as controlling systems and mechanical engineering in order to produce design solutions unifying the subfields and to create smart systems.

Join us at Satakunta University of Applied Sciences (SAMK) to shape your future! And why with us? Because at SAMK you will learn with us to combine theory with practice. You will gain knowledge and understanding of how to solve problems in complex industrial environments. In four years of studies, you will not only know what automation, robotics, construction design or mechanical engineering are, but you will also know how to solve the problems of the future and improve the industry and business with your knowledge and skills.

In our laboratories you have a chance to experiment, as we believe that in order to learn you need to be able to see, to feel, to make mistakes and to find solutions. You need to plan and execute projects, you need to be able to sell your ideas and you need to be able to work in a multidisciplinary team of experts. The acquisition, sharing and collaborative collection of knowledge is one of the key factors for success.

During the four years of full-time studies, the programme will guide your way to pursuit your career in an exciting and versatile field of technology. Are you ready to meet the challenge and take actions for your future in mechatronics? Are you ready to join us? Then pack your bags with interest, high motivation to get to the bottom of things, determination, and openness to cooperate!

Are you interested in a career in global textile business? Our Bachelor’s degree programme provides you with working life skills and gives you the confidence to start your own career in the textile business.

The demand for textile specialists able to solve sustainability challenges is constantly increasing and they will play a key role in the global business.

This Bachelor's degree in Textile and Material Engineering focuses on the different textile manufacturing processes, ecological and biobased textile fibers. The degree will give you the ability to work as a professional in purchasing, in marketing and in managing of development and production in textile industry.

Your studies will progress from basics knowledge of materials to value chains of global textile industry as well as sustainability challenges of global business.

After graduation, you will have several career options as material and textile specialist in industry, in business or in public organizations.  To give a few examples, you could start your career as sales engineer, design engineer or production engineer and proceed in various managerial positions.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering (UAS), Textiles and Clothing Technology

kuvaus.en:
What competencies does the graduate have?

A purchasing and logistics expert understands the roles of organisations in international value networks. They also know how to act in business relationships as individuals to enhance organisations' business objectives. A graduate also knows how to ensure that goods, information, capital, and people move efficiently, effectively, and economically in both the domestic and international environment. A purchasing and logistics engineer can search for information, analyse and take decisions considering both technical, economic, and sustainable development aspects. A graduate has a future-oriented mindset that supports continuous development of businesses and organisations.

What kind of learning methods are used in the programme?

Teaching methods include interactive lectures, work-based assignments and projects, laboratory exercises, information system and software exercises, simulation games, company visits, internships, and theses. Students are encouraged to complete part of their studies (1-2 semesters) in international student exchange. They also have an opportunity to complete the required practical training abroad.

What kind of career opportunities does the graduate have?

Purchasing and logistics engineers are needed everywhere regardless of the field or size of the organisation. Graduates can work, for example in industry, trade, or public sector organisations. Graduates may work as planners, developers, managers, consultants, trainers, supervisors or entrepreneurs.

Possible job titles include procurement specialist, buyer, purchasing engineer, procurement and sourcing analyst, logistics engineer, development engineer, inventory manager, supply chain coordinator, warehouse manager, logistics manager or transport manager.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering, Purchasing and Logistics

kuvaus.en:
Robotics engineers are in high demand in several industries such as manufacturing, warehousing, agriculture, healthcare, and delivery. As a discipline, robotics encompasses various technologies and has innovative real-world implementations. For instance, the field of humanoid robotics powered by artificial intelligence is expected to grow rapidly in the near future.

Metropolia UAS’s Robotics Engineering programme offers a multidisciplinary curriculum. You will gain strong competencies in both professional and core engineering subjects. After successfully completing the Robotics degree programme, you will have a strong mathematical, scientific and linguistic foundation on which to build your future learning. You will gain a broad knowledge of automation, artificial intelligence, and the mechanics of machines. You will also master several areas of robotics with applications.

This programme is conducted as a blended implementation: it combines online learning and classroom teaching. You will have a fixed number of classes that you will attend on campus; the rest of the teaching is conducted remotely or online.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering (UAS), robotisation and artificial intelligence
Bachelor of Engineering, Robotics, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en:
The degree programme in Sustainable Construction Technology prepares students for international careers in construction engineering, across various fields within the construction industry, including management, commercial roles, product manufacturing, research and development.

The programme integrates theoretical and practical aspects, equipping students for a wide range of roles within the construction field. Additionally, you will acquire the skills and knowledge necessary to pursue further studies towards a master's degree.

As a result, you will develop into an international construction engineer with expertise in sustainability. You will also cultivate communication skills and the ability to thrive in multicultural workplace environments.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering (UAS), Building Construction, Community Development
Bachelor of Engineering, Sustainable Construction Technology

kuvaus.en:
What competencies does the graduate have?

You will learn to design environmentally friendly urban environments and transport systems using tools like service design, AI and data analysis.

What kind of learning methods are used in the programme?

You learn through lectures and group work coached by teachers (contact teaching) as well as independent online studies. You will also learn through games, simulations, and other digital tools in urban design. Your studies focus on applying knowledge and skills gained in hands-on projects, internships, or a thesis, often commissioned by HAMK's industry and business partners.

What kind of career opportunities does the graduate have?

You become an engineer who can design sustainable cities with a specialisation in mobility, infrastructure or data management. You will work with professionals from different fields and act as a specialist in sustainable design in international companies in Finland or abroad.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering, Sustainable Urban Design

kuvaus.en:
Join us on a journey where Water Use, Reuse, Recycle, and Management gets a modern technological twist to embark on a Sustainable Future!

Passionate about solving environmental problems such as water scarcity, pollution or disaster? Do you believe sustainable practices and technologies can make a difference? If so, our unique degree program is for you! We combine the study of Water Technology with Sustainability, enabling you to develop innovative solutions to environmental problems using cutting-edge technologies such as Environmental Modeling, Water and Wastewater Management and Treatment, and Remote Sensing.

You will learn skills like Environmental Sampling and use Laboratory Skills to analyze issues and solutions. You will also be able to develop sustainable resource management and circular economy solutions to water and environmental problems and communicate with data, graphics, and sustainability/scientific reporting.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Engineering, Water Technology and Sustainability
South-Eastern Finland University of Applied Sciences Xamk

kuvaus.en:
Bachelor's Degree in Esports Business

The objective of the Bachelor’s Degree in Esports Business is to provide students with high-quality, practical yet academically comprehensive education in the field of esports. The degree emphasizes the development of business and operational skills specifically required in the fast-paced and constantly evolving esports industry, with a strong focus on business landscape, event management, and marketing. As a business degree, the program equips students not only to thrive within the dynamic esports ecosystem but also to build a strong foundation for careers in global business.

Students’ professional competence will be built upon a multidisciplinary knowledge base that includes esports ecosystems, business strategy, media production, and team leadership and coaching. In addition to theoretical understanding, students will develop practical and interpersonal skills essential for working in diverse teams, organizations, and international networks.

 

The education prepares students to work in esports organizations, gaming and media companies, event production agencies, or digital marketing firms to name a few. They will also possess the entrepreneurial know-how to establish and manage their own esports-related ventures.

 

The studies consist of basic studies, professional studies, free choice studies as well as bachelor's thesis that provide a comprehensive foundation in both business and esports. A key component of the studies is a 30 ECTS practical training, which provides students with valuable hands-on experience in real-world business or esports environments.

Part of the studies can also be completed abroad, offering students valuable international experience in the global esports landscape. The studies are offered fully in English.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Business Administration (UAS), Economics, Administration and Marketing
Bachelor of Esports Business, Kajaani University of Applied Sciences, KAMK

kuvaus.en:
The Degree Programme Bachelor of Health Care, Biomedical Laboratory Science educates experts in clinical laboratory work. The studies are based on biomedical laboratory science supported with knowledge in biomedical sciences, and the work includes collecting specimens, performing diagnostic testing, as well as performing near patient examinations in the presence of the patient. Professional communication and quality control are also key topics during the studies and work in the clinical laboratory. Laboratory test results yield information for detecting, diagnosing, monitoring, or treatment of disease. A Biomedical Laboratory Scientist works both independently and as part of a team. In the work, initiative, and accuracy are valued.

The studies include group work, lectures, independent and virtual learning, laboratory work, various examinations, and work-based projects. Supervised internship is included in the studies from the second semester. The internship also provides an opportunity for students to make contacts with the Labour market.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Biomedical Laboratory Technologist (Polytechnic)
Bachelor of Health Care, Biomedical Laboratory Science

kuvaus.en:
The Finnish nursing degree is highly valued and provides good opportunities for working and being employed also internationally. The goal of the education is to train health care professionals to promote and maintain health, to prevent illnesses and to promote quality of life in the population. Evidence-based nursing care is implemented to comprehensively meet the needs of clients and patients of all ages. Nursing education gives you qualifications to work as an expert in different areas of health care, e.g. in primary health care, hospital, private services, third sector organisations or as an entrepreneur. You will be able to get also knowledge, and skills to work independently and in different multiprofessional/international teams.

As a nurse you will master the comprehensive and advanced knowledge of your own field, which includes critical understanding and evaluation of the theories, central concepts, methods and principles. You will understand the scope and limits of professional duties and/or discipline and you will be capable of decision-making in unpredictable environments. Besides being responsible for the evaluation and development of own’s professional competence, as a nurse you will be responsible for the development and nursing care of individuals and groups. You will also achieve knowledge on how to communicate both orally and in writing in English and Finnish.

You can read more about the studies in the programme in the curriculum.

Our graduate students have given good feedback on the quality of teaching, teaching arrangements and the professional skills of the teachers in the degree programme in nursing.

The decision on the tuition fees is based on the change of law on universities of applied sciences, which obligates the universities of applied sciences to collect a fee from the degree students who come from outside the EU/ETA area. The tuition fee for an academic year will be 9500 euros for students who come from outside the EU/ETA area. More information of the tuition fee and scholarships in Satakunta University of Applied Sciences, you will find on our webpage.

The main language of the degree programme is English. If one’s native language is not Finnish, Finnish language is studied during the studies. In addition, students are offered Finnish as elective studies. Part of the studies will be implemented both in English and Finnish. During your studies you have possibility to co-operate also with Finnish language degree programme students.

Students will study Finnish language in accordance with the curriculum to achieve the Finnish language skills needed in clinical practices and nursing profession. Language proficiency skills can be demonstrated by separate language proficiency tests. Tests are arranged by the state administration or by general language proficiency tests.

Studies take place on campus

Studies are conducted during daytime generally Monday-Friday as contact teaching on SAMK campus in Pori. Studying requires full-time studying and presence on our campus. When students go to clinical practices they will do also evening, weekend and night shifts.


Health requirements

When you are applying to study in the field of Health Care and Social Services must have a sufficient good health status and functional capacity to be capable of completing practical assignments and work placement periods as part of the studies. Information about health and vaccination requirements in this field is available on UAS website.

Those applying to the field should bear in mind that:

  • studying and working in a profession of this field require good mental balance
  • the field is not suitable for illegal drug users or for alcohol or legal drug abusers
  • conditions such as musculoskeletal diseases, chronic skin diseases, allergies and mental health disorders may lead to health issues during studies or later in working life
  • several operational units of social and health care treat patients that are exposed to infections, and work in those units requires that the staff’s immunisation is in order.

Satakunta University of Applied Sciences may cancel admission for the following reasons:

  • an applicant fails to submit certificates by the deadline specified by the university of applied sciences
  • an applicant has provided false information about his or her grades
  • it is obvious that the student, in terms of their health status and functional capacity, does not meet the admissions criteria (Polytechnics Act 932/2014)
  • an applicant has concealed the cancellation of their prior study entitlement (Polytechnics Act 932/2014).

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Registered Nurse
Satakunta University of Applied Sciences SAMK

kuvaus.en:
As a nurse, you plan, implement and evaluate drug treatment and various treatment procedures. You also conduct examinations and take into account the individual needs of each patient, even in demanding situations. You work in responsible positions, as a nursing expert in a multi-professional work community in public and private service provider units and in third sector organizations/associations. The core of your profession is the prevention and treatment of diseases, as well as the assessment of the client/patient's condition using various methods and supporting functional capacity in the event of illness.

We invest in face-to-face teaching because without it, competent nurses cannot be created.

In addition, the work includes guiding, advising and supporting the patient's relatives. In VAMK's nursing education, you get to practice various care situations, from operating rooms to emergency care and maternity care.

During your nursing studies, you will acquire a strong theoretical foundation and study practical skills in simulations in a modern clinical skills training environment at the University of Applied Sciences. Your studies include 50 weeks of work placement in various care environments and you will also complete a work-life-oriented thesis.

Nursing studies involve various projects and organizing events and activities. At the same time, you will learn the teamwork and organizational skills necessary in the profession.

Future nurses have been involved in memory buddy activities, where a person with memory loss gets a friend from a student, and the student gains important experience in meeting people with memory loss. The students have also been able to teach first aid skills to city residents, organize blood donation events, and have been involved in various health-promoting campaigns.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Registered Nurse

kuvaus.en:
The purpose of the bilingual Nursing degree programme is to train nursing professionals, who are capable of working in health care services in Finland using the Finnish language. The programme is bilingual (English and Finnish) and it is conducted partially in cooperation with Metropolia University of Applied Sciences and Tampere University of Applied Sciences.

Applicants must have the minimum of B2 level in the English language (according to the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages) to be accepted to the programme. There is no requirement for Finnish language skills. In the beginning, the studies will mostly be conducted in English, with Finnish language teaching gradually taking over. During the studies the Finnish language skills are improved, and by the time of graduation students will have reached the sufficient language proficiency in order to work in Finland as a nurse.

In the beginning, the studies will mostly be conducted in English, with Finnish language teaching gradually taking over. Finnish language is integrated in the courses from the beginning of the studies. During the studies, the Finnish language skills are improved, and by the time of graduation, students will have reached the sufficient language proficiency in order to work in Finland as a nurse. In the curriculum, there are no elective studies other than Finnish language.

The nursing studies combine practical skills with strong theoretical knowledge. To be able to help others, a nurse should be in good health and have the ability to function. As a nurse, you will plan, conduct and evaluate the care of patients together with the patient themselves and their next of kin. You will guide and advise patients. The job requires independent decision-making, as well as taking initiative and responsibility.

The studies consist of theoretical nursing studies, multidisciplinary studies, practical training and the final project. The studies highlight intercultural communication and operating in the environments of Finnish health care services. You should be motivated and commit to developing your Finnish language skills to the required level.

The study programme uses a variety of teaching techniques. The studies are mostly provided as contact teaching on campus, as simulation learning, and by training practical skills both independently and with other students. Some theoretical studies take place online.

Graduates will be able to work in a wide range of positions in the health care field, working both independently and in multi-professional teams. You may find employment in primary health care, specialised nursing units or the private health care sector. In addition to these, the nurse’s degree will enable you to work as an expert or consultant, for a non-profit organization or in international duties.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Registered Nurse
Bachelor of Health Care, Nursing (aimed at immigrants)

kuvaus.en:
​What competencies does the graduate have?

A nurse is a nursing expert, whose duty in society is to implement and develop nursing, which promotes and maintains health, prevents and heals diseases, and rehabilitates. A nurse is able to utilise nursing research skills when planning, implementing, evaluating and developing nursing. In addition, nursing skills require a multidisciplinary knowledge base, such as an up-to-date theoretical knowledge of medical science and pharmacology, as well as of social and behavioural sciences.

A nurse works with individuals, families and communities in different life situations. A nurse provides nursing care to people of different ages and their close relatives when they face illness, disability and death at different ages. A nurse also cares for dying patients in hospice care and supports their loved ones.

Education of nurses is based on the Professional Qualifications Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council, which defines the core skills of a nurse responsible for general care (180 ECTS).

The development of student's knowledge in different areas of clinical competence is assessed throughout the entire study time with nationally agreed criteria. After studying 180 ECTS credits, the nursing student must pass a national exam, which evaluates the areas of professional competencies of a nurse as described above.

What kind of learning methods are used in the programme?

Education of nurses utilises a wide range of student-oriented teaching, learning and evaluating methods, such as activating lectures, simulations, clinical practice, workshops, seminars, projects with working life partners and independent study. These teaching and learning methods develop the competencies and skills needed in working life, such as digital skills.

91 ECTS of the programme is realised through clinical practice supporting the professional competence. Internships can take place in various social and health care environments such as hospitals, health care centres, outpatient clinics and third sector organisations (NGOs).

What kind of career opportunities does the graduate have?

A graduated nurse works as a health care professional licensed by the National Supervisory Authority for Welfare and Health (Valvira). Valvira verifies the language skills of nurses since nurses must have sufficient Finnish or Swedish skills in order to work in a safe manner.

A nurse can work in nursing positions in social and health care environments, such as general health care, specialized medical care, social welfare units, as well as private and third sectors in Finland and in the EU countries.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Registered Nurse
Bachelor of Health Care, Nursing - Lapland UAS

kuvaus.en:
What competencies does the graduate have?

A nurse is a nursing expert, whose duty in society is to implement and develop nursing, which promotes and maintains health, prevents and heals diseases, and rehabilitates. A nurse is able to utilise nursing research skills when planning, implementing, evaluating and developing nursing. In addition, nursing skills require a multidisciplinary knowledge base, such as an up-to-date theoretical knowledge of medical science and pharmacology, as well as of social and behavioural sciences.


A nurse works with individuals, families and communities in different life situations. A nurse provides nursing care to people of different ages and their close relatives when they face illness, disability and death at different ages. A nurse also cares for dying patients in hospice care and supports their loved ones.

Education of nurses is based on the Professional Qualifications Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council, which defines the core skills of a nurse responsible for general care (180 ECTS). The professional expertise of a nurse is defined nationally and it consists of the following areas:

Professionalism and ethics; Customer orientation; Communication and multiprofessionalism; Health promotion; Management and skills in being an employee; Information technology and recording; Guidance and teaching expertise and support for self-care; Clinical nursing; Evidence-based activities, utilisation of research data, and decision-making; Entrepreneurship and development; Quality assurance; Social and health care service system; and Patient and customer safety.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Registered Nurse
Bachelor of Health Care, Nursing TopUp

kuvaus.en:
The purpose of the Nursing degree programme is to train nursing professionals, who are capable of working in health care services in Finland and other countries.

A student may be admitted to degree-awarding education only after they have completed the preparatory/pathway studies. Before the preparatory/pathway studies the entrance examinations are held and the student’s eligibility to apply will be verified from the students’ degree certificates. Before being admitted to degree-awarding education, the student must pass all study units included in the preparatory studies (English language B2, Finnish language A 2.1., other study units (according to the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages). During the studies learning the Finnish language skills are mandatory, and by the time of graduation students need reached the sufficient language proficiency in order to work in Finland as a nurse.

The nursing studies combine practical skills with strong theoretical knowledge. To be able to help others, a nurse should be in good health and have the ability to function. As a nurse, you will plan, conduct and evaluate the care of patients together with the patient themselves and their next of kin. You will guide and advise patients. The job requires independent decision-making, as well as taking initiative and responsibility.

The studies consist of theoretical nursing studies, multidisciplinary studies, practical training and the academic thesis. The studies highlight intercultural communication and operating in the environments of Finnish health care services. You should be motivated and commit to developing your Finnish language skills to the required level.

The study programme uses a variety of teaching techniques. The studies are provided as contact teaching on campus, as simulation learning, and by training practical skills both independently and with other students. Some theoretical studies take place online and there is also independent learning parts. Laurea is using pedagogical model, Learning by Developing, and there will be also co-operation with local health care companies.

Graduates will be able to work in a wide range of positions in the health care field, working both independently and in multi-professional teams. You may find employment in primary health care, specialised nursing units or the private health care sector. In addition to these, the nurse’s degree will enable you to work as an expert or consultant, for a non-profit organization or in international duties.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Registered Nurse
Bachelor of Health Care, Nursing, Laurea UAS International Separate application

Some theoretical studies take place online and there is also independent learning parts. Laurea is using pedagogical model, Learning by Developing, and there will be also co-operation with local health care companies.

Graduates will be able to work in a wide range of positions in the health care field, working both independently and in multi-professional teams. You may find employment in primary health care, specialised nursing units or the private health care sector. In addition to these, the nurse’s degree will enable you to work as an expert or consultant, for a non-profit organization or in international duties.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Registered Nurse
Bachelor of Health Care, Nursing, Laurea UAS International Separate Application

kuvaus.en:
The purpose of the Nursing degree programme is to train nursing professionals, who are capable of working in health care services in Finland and other countries.

The nursing studies combine practical skills with strong theoretical knowledge. To be able to help others, a nurse should be in good health and have the ability to function. As a nurse, you will plan, conduct and evaluate the care of patients together with the patient themselves and their next of kin. You will guide and advise patients. The job requires independent decision-making, as well as taking initiative and responsibility.

The studies consist of theoretical nursing studies, multidisciplinary studies, practical training and the academic thesis. The studies highlight intercultural communication and operating in the environments of Finnish health care services. You should be motivated and commit to developing your Finnish language skills to the required level.

The study programme uses a variety of teaching techniques. The studies are provided as contact teaching on campus, as simulation learning, and by training practical skills both independently and with other students. Some theoretical studies take place online and there is also independent learning parts. Laurea is using pedagogical model, Learning by Developing, and there will be also co-operation with local health care companies.

Graduates will be able to work in a wide range of positions in the health care field, working both independently and in multi-professional teams. You may find employment in primary health care, specialised nursing units or the private health care sector. In addition to these, the nurse’s degree will enable you to work as an expert or consultant, for a non-profit organization or in international duties.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Registered Nurse
Bachelor of Health Care, Nursing, Laurea UAS International Separate application

kuvaus.en:
The purpose of the Nursing degree programme is to train nursing experts. The students will receive a theoretical basis, learn professional clinical  skills and establish an ethical foundation that is necessary for nurses.

The studies will prepare the students for the following: customer-oriented nursing, management and entrepreneurship, clinical nursing, social welfare and health care operating environment, evidence-based operation and decision-making, guidance and teaching expertise, promoting health and an ability to cope with daily situations, and the quality and safety of social welfare and health care services.

Nursing graduates will be able to guide, support, treat  and rehabilitate people with different illnesses in cooperation with their next of kin and other professionals.  They will also know how to take care of the persons close to the customer,  as guiding them is an important part of their work.

Evidence-based nursing expertise is enhanced in a variety of learning and operating environments.

Nursing degree graduates will be able to work with customers of different ages, promoting their health and wellbeing and treating their illnesses. The students will also learn to participate in and coordinate various multidisciplinary working groups and networks and to develop their own work practices.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Registered Nurse
Bachelor of Health Care, Nursing, top-up degree, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en:
Would you like to study emergency care in English in an international and multicultural environment? In this bilingual paramedics programme, you get a UAS degree in both paramedics and nursing which meets the requirements of the European Union Professional Qualification Directives. You will begin your studies in English without Finnish language requirement. The programme is also suitable for Finnish speakers who wish to study in English.

Metropolia's degree programme in paramedic provides broad competence in the prehospital care area. The degree enables you to work as an emergency care provider (ALS paramedic) in the network of urgent care services, in co-operation with other agencies. The core of the degree is the emergency patient in prehospital environment and multiagency co-operation. You learn to assess the need for treatment in non-emergency patients and to guide them to the appropriate service for help. Paramedics work, for example, in ambulances, ER, intensive care units, and high dependency units, in emergency departments. A degree in public health nursing also provides an opportunity to work in health-promoting organizations, in various educational and project positions, and as an independent entrepreneur. In addition to public health nursing competence, the graduate public health nurse is also qualified as registered nurse with strong skills in general nursing.

At the beginning of your studies, you will make a personal study plan (PSP). It will be based on the curriculum, your prior learning (RPL) and your individual objectives. During the studies, you can either start learning Finnish from the basics or continue the studies from your own starting level. Finnish language is integrated in the courses from the beginning of the studies. If your first language is not Finnish, the elective studies in your curriculum will be Finnish language studies. If your first language is Finnish, you can select also other elective studies.

In daytime studies, various teaching and learning methods are applied. The studies are mostly provided as contact teaching on campus: Both theoretical and laboratory/simulation learning and by training practical. Some theoretical studies take place online. On Myllypuro campus you will be studying in globally unique learning environments, including highly advanced simulation spaces. The studies include a lot of practice in authentic health care environments.

After graduation, you will be able to work in Finnish language in Finnish healthcare with excellent employment and career opportunities. Studying in bilingual degree programme will enhance your language skills and ability to work also in international environment.

Familiarize yourself with the field-specific requirements on health and functional capacity before submitting your application. You’ll find the field-specific requirements here: Application process – Ammattikorkeakouluun.fi

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Registered Nurse
Bachelor of Health Care (UAS), Emergency Nurse
Bachelor of Health Care, Paramedics, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en: The English Degree Programme in Physiotherapy qualifies you for working with the functional ability of people of all age groups within the field of rehabilitation.

What competencies does the graduate have?

Physiotherapist is a licensed health care professional, and an expert in movement and functional ability. The education focuses on supporting functioning and preventing of disability in people of varies age and different functioning. The education is based on the physiotherapy science. Competence development provides a description of the deepening/advancement of the student’s skills and knowledge from the basic level to advanced level in the following competencies: Physiotherapeutic examination and clinical reasoning, Teaching and counselling, Therapeutic competence, Co-operation and social competence and Technological competence.

What kind of learning methods are used in the education?

The performances in a course can include exercises, exams, written assignments, portfolios and various projects. The studies are partly carried out in small groups. This enables the development of different areas of professional competence and learning skills in group work and client/patient work. A student may perform part of theoretical studies and clinical practice abroad.

What kind of career opportunities does the graduate have?

The graduate may work within the field of rehabilitation both in the private and public sector and another separately approved working environment. The core knowledge is in the field of assessment and support of movement and function. The graduate can work with people of all ages in hospitals, health care centres, private practices, industry, sport clubs, clinics and non-governmental organizations.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care, Physiotherapy, Laurea UAS International Separate Application

kuvaus.en:
Metropolia’s Physiotherapy degree programme aims to train skilled and innovative physiotherapists in a manner in which they develop their own work for the diverse and unpredicted needs of the changing society. The topical themes challenge professionals to continuously learn and reform their operating methods. In accordance with the needs of the social, health and rehabilitation services, the studies emphasise holistic learning and skills for multidisciplinary collaboration, which is based on client understanding and the active inclusion of clients. 

Physiotherapy degree programme includes training in applied exercise and aquatic therapy as well as rescue from water. Basic swimming skills including basic diving skills are required for the studies. 

Physiotherapy degree programme includes also clinical practice, where vaccinations are required, please read about the requirements: FSHS (Finnish Student Health Service) Instructions for social and health care students concerning infectious diseases and vaccinations: https://www.yths.fi/en/services/a-prevention-of-infectious-diseases/instructions-for-social-and-health-care-student/

Studies will begin in English without the Finnish language proficiency requirement, and will form a foundation for self-study and on-the-job learning in terms of Finnish language skills. 

 

Please notice, this content is based on 2024 curriculum and will be updated to 2025 curriculum.

nimi.en: Bachelor of Health Care, Physiotherapy, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en:
Would you like to study public health nursing in English in an international and multicultural environment? In this bilingual public health nursing programme, you get a UAS degree in both public health nursing and nursing which meets the requirements of the European Union Professional Qualification Directives. You will begin your studies in English without Finnish language requirement. The programme is also suitable for Finnish speakers who wish to study in English.

Metropolia's degree programme in public health nursing provides broad-based expertise in public health nursing of people of all ages with strong competence in health promotion. As a public health nurse, you can work in variety of fields in primary health care, such as maternity and child health clinics, school and student health care, occupational health care and health centre. A degree in public health nursing also provides an opportunity to work in health promoting organizations, in various educational and project positions, and as an independent entrepreneur. In addition to public health nursing competence, the graduate public health nurse is also qualified as registered nurse with strong skills in general nursing.

At the beginning of your studies, you will make a personal study plan (PSP). It will be based on the curriculum, your prior learning (RPL) and your individual objectives. During the studies, you can either start learning Finnish from the basics or continue the studies from your own starting level. Finnish language is integrated in the courses from the beginning of the studies. If your first language is not Finnish, the elective studies in your curriculum will be Finnish language studies. If your first language is Finnish, you can select also other elective studies.

In daytime studies, various teaching and learning methods are applied. The studies are mostly provided as contact teaching on campus: both theoretical and laboratory / simulation learning. Some theoretical studies take place online. On Myllypuro campus you will be studying in globally unique learning environments, including highly advanced simulation spaces . The studies include a lot of practice in authentic health care environments.

After graduation, you will be able to work in Finnish language in Finnish healthcare with excellent employment and career opportunities. Studying in bilingual degree programme will enhance your language skills and ability to work also in international environment.

Familiarize yourself with the field-specific requirements on health and functional capacity before submitting your application. You’ll find the field-specific requirements here: Application process – Ammattikorkeakouluun.fi
