kuvaus.en:
Mastering the art of possible in emerging media

Are you overwhelmed with the rapid change of media? This new degree programme supports you to update your knowledge, develop your skills and expand your networks in Finland and internationally. Moreover, it encourages you to consider sustainability to make the world a better place with emerging media.

This mid-career Master’s degree requires 2 years of work experience after Bachelor’s.

Emerging Media includes new formats, technologies and digital cultures such as virtual and augmented reality as well as constantly changing forms of mobile communications and social media. During the studies, various fields of emerging media are discussed and analysed. Based on your previous work experience and personal interests, you will select at least one focus area in which you develop your skills. The application fields can be, for instance, music or media production, arts, communications, marketing, digital learning, virtual collaboration and developing work practices.

The programme merges emerging media and sustainability, meaning the promotion of wellbeing and tackling of local and global challenges and, on an economic level, e.g. the consideration of business opportunities of emerging media. The studies combine research and practical work in a multidisciplinary way, which encourages to look for ideas from different approaches and practices of media and arts as well as other disciplines.

The studies are organised mainly online, with three separate intensive workshop weeks. Therefore, it is possible to study and have a work at the same time. For your Master’s degree, you will be engaged in active, self-directed learning required for taking over new technologies and application fields. Personal coaching supports this. The duration of the studies is 1-1,5 years depending on the thesis project.

The programme aims to open up new career and business opportunities to media professionals, artists, musicians and designers. It also helps to expand your professional and business networks in Finland and internationally. The three intensive weeks are organised in Mediapolis that is a hub of audiovisual industries in Tampere.

nimi.en: Master of Culture and Arts (UAS), Media
Master of Culture and Arts, Emerging Media

kuvaus.en:
This is the second edition of the Creative Music Production Master's program, consisting of 60 ECTS credits and offered in collaboration between Novia University of Applied Sciences and the Songwriters Academy of Sweden - Musikmakarna.

The program is designed for active professionals in the global music industry who wish to further their career development in creative music production. During the ongoing Master's program, students have participated in meetings with major labels, streaming platforms, renowned studios, and key industry professionals. The diverse professional and cultural backgrounds of the students create a dynamic and interactive learning environment.

The program welcomes applications from songwriters, music producers, artists, or anyone looking to develop their career within this sector of the music industry.

nimi.en: Master of Culture and Arts (UAS), Musician
Master of Culture and Arts, Entrepreneurship in the Arts, Music Production, part-time studies, Novia UAS

kuvaus.en:
Develop your writing for film and television

This degree programme is for students who have a devotion to writing for film and television. The Master’s Degree Programme in Screenwriting focuses on developing and processing innovative film scripts.

This mid-career Master’s degree requires 2 years (24 months) of work experience after Bachelor’s.

The studies cover all the phases of creative screenwriting process. The programme is hands-on and workshop oriented. Classes are based on students’ own material as a work-in-progress. Reflective and critical approach is practised throughout the programme.

You will be supported to work alongside studies by using an online environment and distance education practices. Links to the global film and TV industry provide opportunities to network with key people and to have feedback on your work.

Besides writing for the film or television industry, you may build a career in other satellite professions, such as producer, script editor, storyliner and script consultant.

nimi.en: Master of Culture and Arts (UAS), Media
Master of Culture and Arts, Screenwriting

kuvaus.en:
The Master's program in Sustainable Leadership in Audiovisual Industry provides students with the necessary knowledge and skills to lead and innovate in the dynamic field of audiovisual media. The curriculum is designed to integrate sustainability principles into leadership practices, ensuring ethical, forward-thinking decision-making in the industry.

The program is designed for professionals in the audiovisual sector who seek to advance into leadership roles or improve their management skills with a focus on sustainability. This includes production company supervisors, producers, department heads (HOD – head of department), educators, and other industry experts.

nimi.en: Master of Culture and Arts (UAS), Media
Master of Culture and Arts, Sustainable Leadership in Audiovisual Industry, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en: This master’s degree programme equips you with hands-on experience in planning and executing virtual productions. The programme is for you if you want to extend your skills in film, TV, games, XR, or live events.

nimi.en: Master of Culture and Arts (UAS), Designer
Master of Culture and Arts, Virtual Production
South-Eastern Finland University of Applied Sciences Xamk

kuvaus.en: The programme in Maritime Management has a special focus on building an overall understanding of the maritime field. The studies include management in general, maritime management and for the maritime industry distinctive financial and logistical features. The target is to achieve state of the art competence and knowledge in the area of the programme.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (Seafaring)/Master of Maritime Management, Maritime Management
Master of Engineering (UAS), Energy and Enviromental Engineering
Master of Engineering (UAS), Energy and Enviromental Engineering

kuvaus.en:
The Master’s Degree Program in Smart Industry is a one-year, interdisciplinary program designed for professionals aiming to lead and shape the digital transformation of modern industry. The program focuses on the integration of advanced technologies—such as AI, data analytics and cloud solutions—into smart and sustainable industrial processes.

The curriculum combines professional studies (30 ECTS) with a Master’s thesis (30 ECTS), offering students a balanced mix of theoretical insight and applied research. While the program follows a unified structure, it supports two professional profiles: one for students in the field of technology aiming to advance in digitization, automation, and smart industrial systems, and one for students with a degree in laboratory services seeking to expand their role in data-driven research, quality management, and laboratory automation.

Courses are conducted in English and designed to be completed alongside full-time employment. Learning takes place through interactive lectures in campus, online sessions, independent study, and assignments.

The program prepares students to take on expert and managerial roles in smart industry environments, combining leadership, innovation, and technical skills to drive sustainable and data-informed development.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), Other or Unknown Technology
nimi.sv: Ingenjör (högre YH), annat eller okänt tekniskt område
nimi.fi: Insinööri (ylempi AMK), muu tai tuntematon tekniikka

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), Other or Unknown Technology

kuvaus.en:
Transform the smart future with intelligent wearables.

Wearable Intelligence programme is the first International Master's Program in the field of Wearable Intelligence including Smart Textiles and Exoskeleton Robotics organized by three Fenno-Scandinavian Universities. The market for wearable technology, including wearable intelligence devices and smart textiles, has evolved significantly over the last ten years. Modern society and industry are seeking intelligent wearable solutions to support people physically, mentally, and socially.

The Master’s degree programme in Intelligent Systems is designed for the professional engineer who wants to deepen his or her knowledge and understanding of the methods and possibilities of modern automation and intelligent systems. The student will study automation and control both on a theoretical level and on a practical level – learning to design and use automation systems and how to apply modern techniques of data-driven decision making. A special emphasis is put on the use of machine learning methods in industrial automation and the study of intelligent systems.

The Master's degree programme in Autonomous Maritime Operation is for you who are interested to be a part of the fourth industrial revolution in maritime technology.The programme has a special focus concerning the digitalization of maritime operations. The target is to achieve state of the art competence and knowledge in the area of autonomous maritime operations.

The Master's degree programme in Autonomous Maritime Operation comprises 60 ECTS and the degree title is Master of Engineering, Autonomous Maritime Operations.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Autonomous Maritime Operations

kuvaus.en:
Business Informatics is a Master’s degree program for business and engineering professionals who want to deepen their strategic and managerial skills via better use of business analytics and business information systems.

Master of Business Informatics degree program equips participants to address the challenges of digitization, digital transformation and business analytics in business and work life. The student will become an analyzer and a competent user of business information for decision-making, business operations, and business development. The student will apply his/her knowledge in business modelling, learn how to collect, interpret and analyze data, and craft answers to business critical questions via use of data and business analytics.

The students will also learn how to apply business development methods to drive business growth and innovation. Thus, the program has a strong emphasis on improving general management skills for managers of technology-driven companies for the digital age.

The study group includes students from two backgrounds studying together: Business and Engineering students. Business students will study toward a degree of Master of Business Administration (90 credits), while engineers will study toward a degree in Master of Engineering (60 credits).

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), Other or Unknown Technology
nimi.sv: Ingenjör (högre YH), annat eller okänt tekniskt område
nimi.fi: Insinööri (ylempi AMK), muu tai tuntematon tekniikka

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Business Informatics, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en:
The Master of Engineering, Cloud-Driven Artificial Intelligence is an avant-garde programme, meticulously designed to equip students with the crucial skills and knowledge required in the dynamic fields of cloud computing and artificial intelligence.  

Utilizing the extensive training resources from AWS Academy and Oracle, this degree offers a harmonious blend of theoretical instruction and practical application.

Students will engage in hands-on projects, case studies, and real-world scenarios, preparing them for vibrant and influential careers in the continuously evolving tech sphere. The synergy between AWS and Oracle's robust learning platforms provides students an enriching trajectory of experiential learning, intertwining core theoretical foundations with practical industry-centric experiences.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Cloud-Driven Artificial Intelligence

kuvaus.en:
The student who has completed the program understands the varieties of data created in the real estate and construction industry and has hands-on capabilities to apply, develop and implement modern computational methods and tools to process it, with the purpose of increased quality, sustainability, productivity, and security of construction.

The student is familiar with

  • heterogeneous models about the built environment (building information models, city models, infrastructure models), and
  • sensor and condition data generated by building automation systems and IoT systems.


The student has the skills to

  • utilize computational tools to query, process, and manage the data, and
  • develop and extend models and computational tools for tasks in the construction domain.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), Other or Unknown Technology
nimi.sv: Ingenjör (högre YH), annat eller okänt tekniskt område
nimi.fi: Insinööri (ylempi AMK), muu tai tuntematon tekniikka

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Computing in Construction, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en:
The Data Engineering and Artificial Intelligence (AI) program is aimed at engineers in information technology, electronics, or telecommunications who have gained professional experience and wish to deepen their expertise in data management and artificial intelligence. Upon completion, you will earn UAS Master’s degree from a University of Applied Sciences. 

In the Data Engineering and AI program, your advanced professional competence will expand, offering new perspectives for applying industry practices in your work. You will learn to anticipate changes in the operational environment, form a comprehensive understanding of the need for change, and implement necessary development actions. The studies cover data management, including data collection, preparation, and transformation for data-driven applications. You will also explore machine learning processes and algorithms, as well as artificial intelligence. 

Your work during the studies, including learning assignments and a development project as your thesis, will be closely linked to your professional tasks, enabling you to simultaneously contribute to the development of your employer organization. 

The Data Engineering and AI program is part of Turku UAS Master School and its Professional Excellence offering. The studies consist of common courses shared across all Master-level programs and advanced courses specific to your specialization. The program’s core themes are big data management and the development of AI-based solutions. These themes are also reflected in the thesis, which is typically carried out as a work-related development project. The skills gained in these areas are needed in all types of organizations.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Data Engineering and AI

kuvaus.en: The master’s degree programme Energy Automation Sustainable Engineering is for you who wish to take part in the transition towards more sustainable and circular solutions by using modern engineering skills. Here you will learn how to improve process operation, maintenance and automation, especially within renewable energy systems. This programme – with its unique, Nordic profile within a rapidly changing field – prepares you for taking on leadership roles within various areas of engineering.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Energy Automation Sustainable Engineering

kuvaus.en:
Game Business Management education is specially designed to respond needs and challenges of Game Development Industry. Become familiar with most important topics related to game development management. This, completely new, English-taught, Master’s Degree, is suitable for you, who:

  • want to advance your career into more demanding positions
  • want to shift your career into game development industry
  • want to study part-time, fully online, possibly beside your work
  • have engineering background
  • want to be part of network with like-minded professionals in the field of game development

The studies focus on topics such as management and leadership skills, international game business and game development project management. They include versatile business development methods as well as future oriented perspectives on emerging technologies and intelligent solutions. The curriculum is based on the national competence framework (NQF). The competences are learning skills, ethical, work community, innovation, and internationalization competence.

The aim of the Master´s Degree in Game Business Management at KAMK is to educate experts and managers for game development companies and other organizations. The general objective of the degree is to provide management competencies and a deeper understanding of different aspects of business in the fast changing global environment. The studies support personal growth for challenging management and R&D tasks. Furthermore, it brings transferable life-long learning skills and an opportunity to expand professional networks.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), Technological Competence Management
Master of Engineering, Game Business Management (part-time), Kajaani University of Applied Sciences, KAMK

kuvaus.en:
Health Business Management (HBM) is a Master’s degree program for Bachelors of Engineering professionals who have work experience from and/or career plans to work in the restructuring of social and health care field. 

With a multidisciplinary approach, innovative solutions and new business models are sought after to renew the sector: how to provide services economically and efficiently, yet maintaining high quality and human-oriented scope in all decisions and activities. Business graduates, engineering graduates, as well as graduates from Health Care and Social Services, will jointly tackle the various problem-solving situations and learning tasks. Sharing everyone’s expertise brings added value. 

The HBM Master’s students will be offered an environment to practice and enhance their international and communication skills in a very multicultural group of peers, staff and faculty.

Thesis (30 ECTS): Students demonstrate independent research and development capabilities within their area of expertise. The thesis also serves as evidence of the student’s academic communication skills. It is often carried out in cooperation with the student's employer, public/private sector organisations, Metropolia's innovation hubs, or other partners.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), Other or Unknown Technology
nimi.sv: Ingenjör (högre YH), annat eller okänt tekniskt område
nimi.fi: Insinööri (ylempi AMK), muu tai tuntematon tekniikka

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Health Business Management, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en:
The programme in Industrial Management and Engineering enhances, strengthens and fosters the students' ability and readiness to lead business companies mainly within the industrial sector but also the public sector, nationally and internationally.

Industrial Management and Engineering equips you with insights and tools needed to capitalize on future business challenges. Additionally it equips you to create corporate financial value for shareholders and other constituencies linked to leadership, decision-making, artificial intelligence and analytics.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), Other or Unknown Technology
nimi.sv: Ingenjör (högre YH), annat eller okänt tekniskt område
nimi.fi: Insinööri (ylempi AMK), muu tai tuntematon tekniikka

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Industrial Management and Engineering

kuvaus.en:
In the Industrial Management Master's program the participants will

  • understand the strategic management process and key performance dynamics in firms
  • gain best practice in 1.Service Business including customer orientation in service design and development for a global business context
  • develop insight into new business opportunities in 2.Logistics Management
  • practice 3. Process development and improvement and learn about innovation for corporate renewal
  • appreciate relationship management and 4. Technical sales skills in business-to-business contexts
  • boost the skills in personal & team leadership skills
  • improve the English-speaking and communication skills
  • enhance the conceptual skills and skills in analysis, research and development
  • advance the problem solutions and people management skills through a real-life company project, a Master’s thesis, which will bring a Master of Engineering degree.

Industrial Management is a high quality, compact one year Master’s degree program, expanding the participant's engineering background with MBA-type of managerial and business knowledge.

Industrial Management Master's is a 1-year program that allows the participants to study alongside a full-time job. The program has been developed in collaboration with leading industrial companies.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Industrial Management, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en:
The Master's Degree Programme in Industrial Quality Management is part of Turku University of Applied Sciences’ (Turku UAS) Master School. Turku UAS’ Master School brings together all Master's degree programmes at Turku UAS in the fields of Business, Culture, Healthcare and Social Services, and Technology. It gives the students an excellent chance to create new multidisciplinary networks with other experts both in Finland and globally. The Master’s degrees are divided in two expert paths: The School of Professional Excellence focuses on developing the skills and competences needed as a specialist in the selected discipline whereas the School of Leadership Excellence provides the students a possibility to study and acquire skills and competences needed as a business leader and manager.

The Industrial Quality Management programme focuses on developing the necessary abilities for planning and developing quality system processes, and continuous improvement and creative problem solving for the organizations’ needs in industry.

The Master's degree programme in Industrial Quality Management is a strongly working-life oriented programme (60 credits), which gives students the opportunity to grow into an expert in the field of quality. The aim of the studies is to develop and deepen the student's professional skills and competences in the industrial quality framework. The studies strongly support the student to develop into demanding expert and supervisor jobs.

In the Industrial Quality Management programme, the study assignments as well as the Master's thesis are related to the student's work. Therefore, the employer organization will also benefit from the studies and will have a great opportunity to develop the quality management tools and methods in the organization.

The Master's degree composes of core competences, complementary competences and thesis work. Part of the mandatory core competence studies are common for all Master School programmes and part are specific for the Industrial Quality Management programme. Students have a chance to affect the content of their studies. Complementary competence studies include elective studies that can be taken freely from the other Turku UAS Master's programmes or from the Master’s programmes of other universities. In most cases, the thesis work is done as a working life development project.

The themes of industrial quality management studies include principles of quality management in an industry, different quality tools and lean principles in practical consideration. The training also includes research and development method studies.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Industrial Quality Management

kuvaus.en:
Do you want to become an expert in cloud computing and applications? Master’s programme in Cloud-Based Software Engineering gives you insight and knowledge about how to develop, deploy and maintain cloud applications. You will learn to design and architect cloud-based applications.

Cloud Professional has a Desired Skill Set

After completing the degree, you have e.g. the following, valuable skills to:

  • design high-level applications that use cloud as their infrastructure
  • develop cloud solutions and identify best practices for building and deploying secure applications
  • design systems that are secure, reliable, high-performing and cost efficient and
  • anticipate and analyze the change needs of a work community, and understands the need for strategic renewals.

At Vaasa University of Applied Sciences, you will gain a strong theoretical basis for practical problem solving. These are highly valuable in future’s working life!

For more information visit the webpage of Vaasa university of applied sciences.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Information Technology, Cloud-Based Software Engineering, VAMK

kuvaus.en:
Our aim is to educate you to work in advanced specialist tasks in the field of ICT, focusing on two fields: Networking and Services, and Medical Technology. The studies enable you to follow the professional development of the field, both from the applied research and practical viewpoints. Continuous learning is a must in all professional tasks and ICT is one of the fastest developing technical fields.

The program is targeted for professionals in working life wishing to become a Master in Information Technology. Studies are designed and implemented in such a way that students in full-time employment can participate.

The Master´s degree gives a student the latest knowledge in a specialized area of Information Technology by giving the following competencies:

  • Broad view to information and medical technology presented by leading companies in the field
  • Up-to-date knowledge on selected topics
  • Ability to conduct a professional research study
  • Ability to evaluate and develop your own knowledge and capabilities
  • Valuable network of experts to boost your career

The degree consists of Professional Studies (30 ECTS) and Master’s thesis project (30 ECT). Studies consist of lectures, laboratory work, workshops, assignments, and projects as well as independent studying. The professional studies are offered at the Myyrmäki campus at Vantaa (Networking and Services) and at the Myllypuro campus at Helsinki (Medical Technology).  More information about the program can be found in Metropolia web pages.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Information Technology, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en: The Master’s degree programme in Intelligent Systems is designed for the professional engineer who wants to deepen his or her knowledge and understanding of the modern techniques for designing and implementing intelligent solutions for industrial purposes. A special emphasis is put on the use of machine learning methods to enable industrial automation, augmented assistance in decision making and exploring the possibilities with generative models.

The Master of Engineering – Interactive Technologies is centred on full-stack development for programmers. The programme is designed to equip students with the comprehensive skills and in-depth knowledge required to excel in the dynamic field of full-stack interactive technology development. This intensive programme offers a rigorous curriculum that blends theory and hands-on experience, preparing graduates to tackle the challenges of modern software development. The programme highlights include:

Holistic Skillset: This programme covers the complete spectrum of development, from front-end interactive interfaces to back-end, enabling students to become proficient in both client-side and server-side technologies. Graduates will be well-equipped to create end-to-end solutions independently.

Cutting-Edge Technologies: The curriculum is continuously updated to reflect the latest industry trends and technologies. Students will gain expertise in popular programming languages, frameworks, and tools relevant to full-stack development and the latest applicable interactive technologies, ensuring they stay current in this rapidly evolving field.

Project-Centric Learning: Learning by doing is emphasized through practical projects that simulate real-world scenarios. Students will develop a robust portfolio that showcases their ability to create responsive, interactive, and scalable applications.

Industry Collaborative development: Close ties with industry leaders, guest lectures, workshops, and possible internship opportunities provide students with valuable exposure to the professional world. This collaboration ensures that the curriculum remains aligned with industry needs. Through such team projects, students will learn to collaborate effectively in a development team, simulating the collaborative nature of real-world projects. Communication, version control, and project management skills are emphasized.

User-Centred Design: User experience (UX) and interactive technology user interface (UI) design principles are integrated into the programme to emphasize the importance of creating applications that are intuitive, user-friendly, and visually appealing.

Problem-Solving Emphasis: The programme underscores the development of strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills. Graduates will be adept at debugging, troubleshooting, and optimizing code for efficiency and performance.

The Master of Engineering – Interactive Technologies is designed for individuals with a strong foundation in programming who are seeking to elevate their skills and knowledge to meet the demands of today's interactive technology landscape. Upon completion of the programme, graduates will have a comprehensive understanding of full-stack development, positioning them as valuable assets in the software industry.

The master's degree programme in Machine Intelligence and Data Science (MIND) at Arcada gives you an in-depth understanding of how to make use of data in order to create insights. The programme is arranged so that you rapidly gain a broad knowledge of the essential concepts of data science and engineering: descriptive and predictive modelling, and the construction and deployment of robust machine learning pipelines. The programme emphasises the importance of understanding how to build analytical solutions with production level code.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Machine Intelligence and Data Sience

kuvaus.en:
Enhance your competence as a procurement professional!

During your studies in Procurement Master's Degree Programme, you learn to analyze and develop the procurement function to serve the goals and strategies of a company. The overall goal is to learn about driving value through the supply chain to the end customer, how procurement can be turned into a strategic function and utilize technology as an enabler of effective supply management, how sustainability and collaboration are at the core of procurement and learn how to sell the business case of procurement to the rest of the organization.

After your studies you have gained the needed theoretical and applied knowledge, skills, and competencies to manage and develop company's external resources, supplier relationships, procurement process and procurement organization. In addition to procurement specific competencies you enhance your leadership and business competencies. You will graduate as Master of Engineering.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), Other or Unknown Technology
nimi.sv: Ingenjör (högre YH), annat eller okänt tekniskt område
nimi.fi: Insinööri (ylempi AMK), muu tai tuntematon tekniikka

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Procurement, Metropolia University of Applied Sciences

kuvaus.en:
Do you want to become a confident leader of an international project team?

The Master's Degree in Project Management is a professional higher education degree. The programme focuses on providing students with skills and competencies to work in both local and an international project environment. This master´s degree in Project Management is suitable for business and engineering professionals interested in project management who are seeking a master´s degree in project management, and want to assume project managerial and leadership positions in their organizations.

In Project Management you'll learn and acquire

  • the secrets for building and motivating teams
  • award-winning tools for effective project management and research
  • IPMA level C competence.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), Other or Unknown Technology
nimi.sv: Ingenjör (högre YH), annat eller okänt tekniskt område
nimi.fi: Insinööri (ylempi AMK), muu tai tuntematon tekniikka

kuvaus.en:
The Master's Degree Programme in Quality Management is part of Turku University of Applied Sciences' (Turku UAS) Master School. Turku UAS Master School brings together all Master's degree programmes at Turku UAS in the fields of Business, Culture, Healthcare and Social Services, and Technology. It gives the students an excellent chance to create new multidisciplinary networks with other experts both in Finland and globally. The School of Professional Excellence focuses on developing the skills and competences needed as a specialist in the selected discipline whereas the School of Leadership Excellence provides the students a possibility to study and acquire skills and competencies needed as a business leader and manager.

The Quality Management programme focuses on developing the necessary abilities for planning, developing and managing quality system processes, and continuous improvement and creative problem solving for the organization's needs in the industry and different organizations.

The Master's degree programme in Quality Management is a programme strongly connected to the world of work (60 credits), which gives students the opportunity to grow into experts in the field of quality and continuous improvement. The aim of the studies is to develop and deepen the student's professional skills and competencies in a quality framework. The studies strongly support the student’s development into demanding expert and supervisor jobs.

In the Quality Management programme, the study assignments as well as the master's thesis are related to student's work. Therefore, the employer organization will also benefit from the studies and will have a great opportunity to develop the quality management tools and methods in the organization.

The Master's degree is composed of advanced professional studies, optional studies and thesis work. Part of the mandatory core competence studies are common for all Master School programmes and part are specific for the Quality Management programme. Students have a chance to affect the content of their studies. Optional studies, which are intended to complement a student's skills in Quality Management, can be taken freely from the other Turku UAS’ Master's programmes or from the Masters' programmes of other universities. In most cases, the thesis work is done as a working life development project.

The themes of quality management studies include principles of quality management in an industry, different quality tools,  lean principles and risk management in practical consideration. The education  also includes research and development method studies.

The aim of the Master's Degree Programme in Sales Management is to develop the competences needed in the management positions in a global business environment. You will learn how to act as a manager and an inspiring leader for a sales team and how to guide the team successfully to the desired goals. You will learn to recognize the latest trends and aspects of customer behavior, especially in B2B markets. You will be able to develop strategies for promoting the growth of sales effectively in the sales transformation era.

After completing the degree, you will be capable of managing sales teams also in international markets with adequate cultural understanding and knowledge about the special characteristics of each specific market area. You will also become a skillful negotiator and you will be able to communicate successfully in different teams and in multiple customer situations. The Master´s Degree Programme in Sales Management gives you an excellent opportunity to create new multidisciplinary networks with other experts both in Finland and globally.

The Master´s Degree Programme in Sales Management is targeted to individuals with several years of working experience in sales or as a sales team leader who want to further enhance their knowhow in sales management and leadership. This is the option for you if you are aiming to work at a sales management position in the future or want to update your skills to the demanding sales management and leadership in the digital era.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), project and sales management

kuvaus.en:
This programme in Structural Engineering equips you with insights and tools needed to take a central role in creating sustainable and climate-smart buildings. It is based on requirements for the scope of studies in building technology and structural design of wooden structures for exceptionally demanding structures, as well as study requirements in building mechanics and building physics, in order to have sufficient competence for exceptionally demanding wooden structures. The education meets the requirements of the Finnish Ministry of the Environment guidelines on the qualification of building designers YM2 / 601/2015 and FISE's requirements and criteria for wooden structures and load-bearing structures in wood as well as building physics.

This programme deals also with fire dimensioning, stiffening and sound technology in wooden structures as well as the climate footprint and life cycle calculations of wooden buildings. An important goal in this education is that it prepares you to take a central role in creating sustainable and climate-smart buildings.

These studies are optimized for flexible learning and studying, parallel with fulltime employment preferably at an Engineering Company. A major part of the studies is conducted online, one afternoon each week from September to May, in combination with furthermore weekly self-studies and teamwork.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), Building Construction, Community Development

kuvaus.en:
As a global challenge, urbanization and smart city concepts are major development themes. There is a growing need for multidisciplinary approaches in the planning and management of urban environment development processes. This programme invites applicants to work together in dealing with practical challenges on the theme of urban sustainability. The aim of the study programme is to adapt a multidisciplinary knowledge base, as well as development tools, supporting sustainability management.

The programme is based on online teaching and learning. The thesis work is an opportunity to adapt current academic research to practical needs and situations in the sustainable city.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering, Urban Sustainability, online studies

kuvaus.en:
The Master of Engineering in Virtual Worlds is a future-oriented program tailored for professionals with a strong foundation in programming and interactive technologies. This degree focuses on the full-stack development of immersive, interactive environments, preparing students to lead and innovate in the rapidly evolving domain of virtual world creation. 

This program equips students with the advanced skills and interdisciplinary knowledge required to design, develop, and deploy virtual worlds across diverse platforms. Through a blend of theoretical foundations and hands-on project work, students will master the tools and methodologies essential for crafting responsive, scalable, and user-centered virtual environments. The program highlights include: 

1. Full-Stack Immersive Development 

Students will gain proficiency in both front-end and back-end technologies, with a focus on interactive interfaces, real-time systems, and immersive media. The curriculum supports development across web, mobile, XR (Extended Reality), and game engines, enabling graduates to build end-to-end virtual experiences. 

2. Emerging Technologies & Tools 

The program integrates cutting-edge technologies such as Unity, Unreal Engine, WebXR, and AI-driven interaction systems. Students will work with modern frameworks and languages relevant to virtual world development, ensuring they remain at the forefront of industry innovation. 

3. Project-Based Learning & Portfolio Development 

Learning is anchored in real-world projects that simulate professional scenarios. Students will collaborate on multidisciplinary teams to design and implement virtual worlds, culminating in a robust portfolio that demonstrates their technical and creative capabilities. 

4. Industry Collaboration & Professional Practice 

Strong ties with industry partners provide opportunities for guest lectures, workshops, and internships. These collaborations ensure that students gain practical insights and experience, while also developing essential teamwork, communication, and project management skills. 

5. User-Centered Design & Interaction 

UX/UI design principles are deeply embedded in the curriculum, emphasizing the creation of intuitive, engaging, and accessible virtual environments. Students will explore human-computer interaction, spatial design, and behavioral psychology to enhance user immersion and satisfaction. 

6. Critical Thinking & Problem Solving 

The program fosters analytical thinking and creative problem-solving. Students will learn to debug complex systems, optimize performance, and address challenges in virtual world scalability, interactivity, and user engagement. 

This program is ideal for individuals with a background in software development, game design, digital media, or interactive technologies who wish to specialize in the design and development of virtual worlds. Whether your interest lies in entertainment, education, simulation, or digital twins, this degree provides the tools and expertise to bring immersive experiences to life.

The focus is on providing master-level education for experienced nurses who wish to work in clinical care with more varied and demanding job descriptions. Our programme prepares you to achieve competencies in several areas such as translating evidence into practice, conducting health assessment and providing clinical care in complex decision-making situations assessing and managing common health problems, and leading changes to improve quality care outcomes.

The Acute Care Nursing program is designed to equip nurses with advanced practice competencies, following the International Council of Nurses guidelines.

This master-level education focuses on clinical specialization, preparing nurses to excel in various healthcare settings across Europe.

The curriculum includes core competencies such as advanced practice nursing, evidence-based practice, global health and ethics, research and development, clinical examination, advanced clinical expertise, and the use of simulation in acute care.

Registered Nurses, including Public Health Nurses and Paramedics with RN status, with at least two years of professional experience, can achieve EQF-7 level competence through this program. This international curriculum is ideal for nurses seeking to study internationally or those with an immigrant background.

Taking the Master’s Degree in Development and Leadership of Nursing provides the students with high-level professional competence in developing the care of patients and enables them to work as developers, reformers, experts, and leaders in varying work environments as well as to obtain health care expert positions nationally and internationally. Students also have an opportunity to deepen their competence in their own area of practice.

The field of sport and exercise medicine is a rapidly growing and advancing field both in theory and practice. The physiotherapist has a central role with the knowledge and skills to enhance advanced sport performance as well as improve health through sport participation. This programme provides the skills to develop and implement evidence-based systems for injury prevention, refined clinical reasoning in the rehabilitation processes, performance enhancement and return-to-sport within a multidisciplinary team.

In addition to competitive sports, the programme will provide you with the knowledge and frameworks to promote physical activity throughout the life span and in populations with varying levels of functioning. You will gain skills to adapt and recommend sporting activities while ensuring their safe participation and so maximizing their impact on health outcomes. Focus on emerging technologies to support and enhance the physiotherapist role will be integrated through the programme.

Throughout the program, you will deepen and expand your knowledge of exercise physiology assessment and measurement methods, while exploring and utilizing the latest technology in the field.

You will also develop evidence-based expertise in the rehabilitation of sports and exercise injuries. Upon completing the Master's degree in Sports Medicine and Exercise Physiology, you will be at the forefront of advancements in the field.

The entry to this program is primarily for students graduating from The Master in Culinary Management & Innovation from Institut Lyfe, but students who have completed Master level courses in the above mentioned subjects may also apply. kuvaus.en:
Do you want to develop your skills in tourism business management? Do you work for a company / organization that is seeking growth and planning to internationalize? Do you want to grab this unique opportunity to gain a deeper understanding of different aspects of tourism business in the global operating environment?

The Master´s Degree in Tourism Business Management at Kajaani University of Applied Sciences will help you on your journey towards achieving a management position, developing a strong professional net­work, or even starting your own business. The English-taught Master's Degree at Kajaani University of Applied Sciences is a multidisciplinary program that welcomes applicants with the minimum of a Bachelor's (first cycle) degree qualification.

The degree’s learning objectives and contents focus on tourism business management, strategic management and innovation in global business, research and development methods, and the use of new technologies in business.

Kajaani University of Applied Sciences has been among the top-ranked universities of applied sciences for high-quality education and student guidance in Finland for many years. KAMK owes its success to the people involved in its operation. Its members of staff possess a positive, innovative, and open-minded attitude to their work and the continuous development of their working community. As a result, the Master´s degree opens many doors for its graduates.

The Master´s Degree in Tourism Business Management includes full-time studies (on campus and hybrid) for 2 years. The program comprises a total of 90 ECTS: course work accounts for 60 ECTS and the remaining 30 ECTS are for the graduate thesis. The 60 ECTS of course work includes 12 indi­vidual courses of 5 ECTS each. The courses are designed to provide students with the information they will need to succeed as high-level business lead­ers in today’s modern business environment.

After completing all the required course work, stu­dents will be provided with an advisor to help them plan and prepare the master’s thesis.

Students interested in applying for the program should submit their applications directly to the university within the allotted application period and they must ensure that they meet the admission re­quirements. Students should possess a Bachelor’s degree (first-cycle degree) or a similarly appropriate higher education degree in tourism or service business that includes a minimum of 20 ECTS in business/tourism studies, a minimum of 24 months of work experience in the field of tourism or service busi­ness, and sufficient English language skills to complete the program.

kuvaus.en:
Expert in Tourism and Business Management

By studying in this programme, you will gain the tools to advance your career and enhance your professional profile. You will study in an international student group and develop management expertise in the tourism business environment, learning how to apply this knowledge in a variety of contexts. As a student in a world-class higher education system, you will have a personal tutor appointed by the faculty to support your progress.

This industry-driven programme strengthens the competences needed for strategic management in competitive tourism businesses. It equips you with future-oriented know-how and the tools necessary to address structural and transformational changes in the tourism industry. You will acquire advanced professional competencies and a strong international perspective.

The studies cover advanced theories related to profitable and productive business operations, both at the micro and macro level. A strong emphasis is placed on your personal development and leadership abilities – key elements for building a successful career in tourism. The programme integrates wide-ranging themes such as digitalisation, sustainability, and the international business environment – critical competencies for tourism professionals.

Daytime studies on campus

The studies are conducted on weekdays during daytime hours at the SAMK campus in Pori (Satakunnankatu 23). On average, classes take place three times a week. Regular on-campus attendance is required; this programme does not offer online study options.

kuvaus.en: Maritime Management is a Master’s degree programme for sea captains and marine engineers. Master's programme has been tailored for professionals who want to deepen their managerial expertise in digitalizing and automating shipping as well as gain economical, legal and contractual expertise in maritime business. Students will be able to use the knowledge obtained for development, problem solving and innovation within maritime management and marine engineering. Academic knowledge from legal, economic and technical issues are combined with expertise from the industry. Teaching teams also arrange visits and workshops together with the industry in Finland, Nordic countries, and London.

kuvaus.en:
The Master’s degree programme in Natural Resource Management is for you who wish to deepen your knowledge in sustainable management of natural resources. The studies have a special focus on bioeconomy, i.e., the use of renewable natural resources for producing food, energy, products and services.

You will obtain skills in participatory processes and conflict management in the field of natural resource management. You will also gain advanced project management and leadership skills and be able to improve your communication skills. The degree title is Master of Natural Resources.

kuvaus.en:
To ensure evidence-based, goal-directed development and meaningful change in emergency care systems, our objective is to educate future experts, leaders and researchers with advanced competencies, diverse perspectives, and understanding of systems integrations, safety science, staff well-being, and person-centred emergency care systems at both practical and systems levels.

Health care crises have made it clear that our emergency care systems and acute care pathways are experiencing a fundamental change in perspective. The need for major systemic change is evident, for both better person-centred care and the well-being of our health care professionals.

We need to redesign emergency care as a system. It is necessary to integrate care pathways and existing services, develop new clinical advancements, reshape professional roles, and break old systemic and work cultural barriers within emergency care, such as roles between prehospital acute care, out-of-hospital community paramedicine, and emergency departments. The treatment of acute and critical patients is often volatile, uncertain, complex, and ambiguous (VUCA) environments must be safe, person-centred, and of the highest quality in the future while also addressing the increasing complexity of subacute patient profiles. Therefore, its continuous development requires long-term goals and rigorous processes to succeed and be effective.

We further need to make emergency care work manageable. By breaking silos and disciplinary boundaries and going beyond the scopes of familiar practices, we are sharing new knowledge and further understanding of the complexity, variety, and diversity of work in emergency care systems. We will explore how human-environment work can be further developed to be more sustainable and safer, utilizing, among others, translational simulations and design for psychologically safe work cultures. The goal is to make emergency care systems manageable and sustainable for all health care professionals.

Creativity and different ways to express it, as well as cultural activities and arts related experiences, belong to all people as part of a good and meaningful life. The aim of Master’s degree in Creativity and Arts in Social and Health Fields is to strengthen the professional competences needed when promoting health, well-being, inclusion and a sense of community in society through creativity and arts.

Upon graduation, students are able to reflect in a new way on the importance of creativity in human life and to reconstruct working practices from this perspective. The studies are designed to combine expertise from different fields locally and internationally, as well as to strengthen multidisciplinary and international collaboration skills of professionals.

Health Business Management (HBM) is a Master’s degree program for Bachelors of Business Administration/ Master of Social Services and/or Health Care and Engineering professionals who have work experience from and/or career plans to work in the restructuring of social and health care field. 

With a multidisciplinary approach, innovative solutions and new business models are sought after to renew the sector: how to provide services economically and efficiently, yet maintaining high quality and human-oriented scope in all decisions and activities. Business graduates, engineering graduates, as well as graduates from Health Care and Social Services, will jointly tackle the various problem-solving situations and learning tasks. Sharing everyone’s expertise brings added value. 

The HBM Master’s students will be offered an environment to practice and enhance their international and communication skills in a very multicultural group of peers, staff and faculty.

Thesis (30 ECTS): Students demonstrate independent research and development capabilities within their area of expertise. The thesis also serves as evidence of the student’s academic communication skills. It is often carried out in cooperation with the student's employer, public/private sector organisations, Metropolia's innovation hubs, or other partners.

kuvaus.en:
The Master's Degree Programme in Health care diagnostics is a joint programme for students with biomedical laboratory scientist and radiographer backgrounds. These are health care diagnostic professions having many common features and even shared areas of job description e.g. in the field of nuclear medicine. Acting in the interface of patients, service systems and technology these professions are multifaceted. The program has many common intersections and studies with Health Business Management and Health Technology programmes and also some joint studies with these programmes.

During the studies the student will acquire advanced level competences on research and development as well as project management activities. Upon completion of the advanced professional studies, the student is capable of planning, executing and assessing quality management of clinical laboratory/radiography services. He/she will also get good competences on designing and managing modern diagnostic services including artificial intelligence and robotics based services.

kuvaus.en:
You are most welcome to study community work and multicultural development in cooperation with other international talents!

Tampere University of Applied Sciences TAMK is offering new innovative social policy and humanistic approach programme which gives you an excellent chance to explore global, ecological, and social challenges as well as sustainable development solutions. You will learn how to apply theories and practices of eco-social work, social pedagogy and community work in your current and future environments and work opportunities.

In the programme, you will make insights into the history and future of Nordic welfare systems and discuss hot topics with your co-students and advanced social politicians, pedagogues, and psychologists. You will grow into an expert with knowledge of the principles and practices of the Nordic welfare systems and the ability to apply your skills in your own environment.

Also, you will learn to manage customer relationships and multicultural development processes. The programme orientates you to learn about culturally sensitive work approaches and interaction skills. Most of all, the master’s studies expand your own international networks and understanding of multiculturalism in local and international contexts. You will have an excellent opportunity to collaborate with your new international networks and learn from them alternative approaches and local & international solutions.

In this Master’s degree in Community Work and Multicultural Development you will cooperate with local communities and projects, as well as with international organizations and academies. Studying is flexible as this online studying programme offers you the possibility of part-time or full-time studying anywhere in the world. You also have a chance to get to know other international master’s degree programmes, students, and specialists of TAMK, because we are cooperating closely with them.

You are welcome to apply to this programme if you have a Bachelor’s degree in humanities and social sciences and at least two years (24 months) of documented work experience. Applicable degrees are, for example, Bachelor's in social work and social services, social policy, political science, sociology, psychology, health sciences and education. Feel free to ask and learn more about the topic from the named contact person.

After completing this Master’s degree, you have strengthened your abilities to develop and manage social and health care services as well as educational organizations. With this degree, you will have expertise in theories and practices of multicultural work, sustainable development, and community work, which you can rely on in tasks related to promoting well-being and safety of communities, whether you are employed by the state, municipality, NGO, company, or educational institution. You have also gained valuable knowledge and skills that will strengthen your growth into leadership.

Harness the Power of Data and AI to Shape the Future

Digitalization is rapidly reshaping society and organizations, driving the demand for new competencies in the workforce. To thrive in this evolving landscape, professionals across industries need to enhance their data skills, recognize AI opportunities, and navigate ethical considerations.

Learn how to leverage data to your advantage and elevate your skills by incorporating artificial intelligence into your expertise.

The Data Expertise and Artificial Intelligence degree program prepares you to excel in specialist and development roles where data and AI are central, or where these technologies will drive future innovation.

Throughout the program, you'll learn to identify data needs and explore data utilization opportunities within your field. You'll develop skills in data analysis and visualization, while gaining hands-on experience with AI methods and applications. No prior ICT knowledge is required to embark on this journey.

kuvaus.en:
The Global Health and Crisis Management (GH&CM) Master's degree programme will focus on health care and crisis leadership, management, and development from the perspectives of global health and humanity, socially sustainable development, evidence-based infection prevention and control, crisis preparedness, management and communication. This Master's program will be realised at European Qualification Level 7.

The students will develop their competences, gain management and evaluation tools, and create working theories and practices for the good of health care service users, personnel, and crisis victims. According to the Laurea’s pedagogical model Learning by Developing (LbD), it is beneficial that the students will gain the core and the complementary competencies and advance them within the development/research project they will participate in. For the students it is possible to select studies also from other Masters' programs at Laurea or at Laurea’s national and international higher education partner institutes according to the personal study plan of the student fulfilling the curriculum requirements.

The graduating students possess abilities to perform evidence-based, ethical, and cross-cultural expertise, leadership and management in global health and crisis contexts. To gain these abilities the students can ”learn by developing” within research and development projects by co-creating public and private, governmental, non-governmental and commercial services, organizations, and contexts. The students can further develop their expertise in infection prevention and control, nutrition and in crisis management. The competences gained in complementary competence studies will be congruent with the European Union guidelines, and global policies and models. The students can realize their learning objectives in global, international, and transnational contexts with Laurea’s strategic international and national partners.

kuvaus.en:
Do you want to be a circular economy change agent?

Climate change, the loss of biodiversity and over-consumption of raw materials requires professionals of a new kind with awareness of planetary boundaries, a solution-centric and change-agent’s mindset to lead the change towards a more sustainable future. The Master's Degree in Risk Management and Circular Economy (RiMCE) brings together students with diverse educational, professional, and cultural backgrounds. Collaborative learning in multidisciplinary and intercultural teams give students competence valued in modern working life.

RiMCE is a professional mid-career Master’s degree and requires 2 years (24 months) of working experience after a Bachelor’s. Because the Bachelor’s degrees are either 240 or 210 ECTS credits also the corresponding Master's are either 60 ECTS (MEng) or 90 ECTS credits (MBA). The applicants with a degree in Bachelor's of Engineering or Business Administration speficially or other suitable Bachelor’s degree can apply to the program.

TAMK has broad expertise in circular economy, excellent network of business partners, and research, development, and innovation (RDI) activities promoting bio- and circular economy. The RiMCE programme operates as a forerunner in circular economy pedagogy providing circular economy theory, viewpoints, and models from practice.

kuvaus.en:
The aim of the programme is to provide students with multidisciplinary knowledge in service innovation and design through advanced studies of different service theories and their implications for service innovation and design practice. The programme brings students to the forefront of recent development in the service innovation and design field by including supervised development training. Another important objective is to improve students' competencies in combining academic rigour with managerial relevance when working on independent projects. 

A central theme of the studies is that service business requires a distinctive approach to strategy, innovation and design. The compulsory studies focus on service logic driven innovation and design competencies. The elective studies enable students to pursue their specific interests in various fields, such as business and leadership, design thinking, sustainable development, and research and development (R&D). The Master’s thesis aims to develop the students’ ability to carry out a demanding R&D project independently. It allows students to deepen their ability to apply theories in practice, their analytical skills, their project management and R&D competence and their social skills. 

The name of the qualification and title conferred is Master of Business Administration. Master's degree will deepen and expand your competence and give you eligibility for roles where a postgraduate degree is required.

kuvaus.en:
Ready to make sustainability your superpower?

Do you want to lead the transition to a sustainable future? 

The global challenges of climate change, resource scarcity, and social inequality demand a new generation of professionals who can turn today’s environmental and social challenges into tomorrow’s opportunities. If you're passionate about creating a better future and want to lead the way in sustainable innovation, the Master’s Degree in Sustainability Management (SusMan) is your next step. 

A Master’s Degree in Sustainability Management is more than a degree, it’s a launchpad for change-makers. SusMan brings together students from diverse academic and professional backgrounds, fostering collaborative learning in multidisciplinary and multicultural teams. This dynamic environment builds the critical thinking, communication, and leadership skills essential in today’s global job market. 

This mid-career Master’s program is designed for professionals with at least 2 years of work experience after a Bachelor’s degree (210 or 240 ECTS). Depending on your academic background, you’ll earn either a 60 ECTS (MSc) or 90 ECTS (MBA) degree. Applicants with degrees in environmental sciences, business, engineering, social sciences, or other relevant fields are encouraged to apply. 

TAMK has broad expertise in sustainability and corporate responsibility, an excellent network of business partners, and research, development, and innovation (RDI) activities promoting sustainability and sustainability management. SusMan integrates theory with real-world practice, offering students the opportunity to work on sustainability challenges through case studies and projects.

Whether you dream of transforming businesses, shaping public policy, or launching your own green venture, SusMan equips you with the mindset and skills to lead the sustainability transition.

nimi.en: Master's Degree Programme in Sustainability Management

kuvaus.en:
Become a Master in Sustainable Packaging Solutions!

The Master’s Degree Programme in Sustainable Packaging at Tampere University of Applied Sciences (TAMK) prepares professionals to lead the packaging industry’s transformation toward a circular economy and respond to increasing regulatory, consumer, and environmental demands. Sustainable packaging has a vital role in supply chain to tackle climate change, plastic pollution, and resource overuse. You’ll learn to create fact-based, environmentally responsible packaging solutions that meet both industry needs and sustainability goals.

This interdisciplinary and international Master’s programme gives you a comprehensive view of the packaging value chain from material innovation, product design and circular economy to regulation, AI utilization, eco-management, and lifecycle thinking. You’ll deepen your expertise in packaging materials such as paper, cardboard, plastics, glass, and metal, and their production and life cycle scenarios. You will strengthen your skills in life cycle assessment, research, communication, and international project management.

With a Bachelor’s degree in engineering and at least two years of work experience, your learning takes place through hands-on projects and real-world case studies, supported by TAMK’s strong RDI activities and circular economy expertise. You also have the opportunity to complete part of your studies at TAMK’s international partner higher educational institutions (HEIs). You will graduate with a qualification that prepares you to lead sustainable packaging innovation on a global scale.

nimi.en: Master of Engineering (UAS), Energy and Enviromental Engineering
Master's Degree Programme in Sustainable Packaging

kuvaus.en:
The Technology Law Programme aims to produce legal and tech professionals who not only understand the legal intricacies of technology but are also proactive, ethical, resilient, and equipped to contribute positively to society and organizations in the rapidly evolving tech-driven world. 

The compulsory studies (30 ECTS) will all be available completely online, provided by Laurea teachers and will be in English. The courses will consist of courses focusing on international technology contract law and negotiation skills, legal issues related to the commercialization of high technology, intellectual property rights and their strategic role in technology companies and other innovative organizations, privacy, cyber resilience, data ownership, and their growing significance as organizational assets within the framework of a fair data economy, legal and ethical considerations in the utilization of artificial intelligence, consumer, and marketing law, especially in digital consumer marketing; and utilization and development of legal tech tools.  In addition, resilience skills form an integral part of the programme, along with ethics as well as the broader concept of Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) and Environmental, Social, and Governance criteria (ESG). The amount of online master level courses in English provided by both Laurea and other universities of applied sciences is continuously increasing. The student can choose his/her elective courses from this common offering and include some international offering in his/her elective studies. The student can also register for elective on campus courses and, language skills permitting, available in Finnish. The student is encouraged to include courses, in elective studies, on how to do research and on how to develop (both relate to methods). 

The name of qualification and title conferred is Master of Business Administration. Master's degree will deepen and expand your competence and also give you eligibility for roles where a postgraduate degree is required.

kuvaus.en:
Sustainable actions in business begin with inspired, engaged leaders.

At Häme University of Applied Sciences, we empower you to navigate the complex demands of today’s global economic, social, and environmental challenges. Throughout the studies, you develop both theoretical insights and hands-on industry knowledge, equipping you with essential skills to drive sustainability within your organization or step into role centered on sustainable practices.

 

By completing the Master’s Degree Programme in Management in Sustainable Business, you’ll become a skilled sustainability practitioner ready to integrate sustainable practices across your organization’s value chain. You'll gain the tools to make informed, impactful decisions that foster long-term value, propel your career, and drive meaningful change in sustainable business.

kuvaus.en:
This Master's program is for the student with an independent mindset, who wants to influence and change the surrounding world. We seek to build champions that can act in pivotal positions in organizational transformation projects or in changing networked environments. These individuals have broad skill sets, come from various backgrounds and are good communicators. They have experience in projects and are interested in developing both their research and development skills.

The compulsory studies (30 ects credits) will all be available completely online, provided by Laurea teachers and will be in English. The courses will consist of courses focusing on consumer behavior and brands, the Nudge – influencing individual and group behavior, modelling laws, the digital economy, digital marketing and living in a changing world – an international perspective.

The amount of online master level courses in English provided by both Laurea and other universities of applied sciences is continuously increasing. The student can choose his/her elective courses from this common offering and include some international offering in his/her elective studies. The student can also register for elective on campus courses and, language skills permitting, available in Finnish. The student is encouraged to include courses, in the elective studies, on how to do research and on how to develop (both relate to methods).

The name of qualification and title conferred is Master of Business Administration. Master's degree will deepen and expand your competence and also give you eligibility for roles where a postgraduate degree is required.

kuvaus.en:
Advanced Practice Nursing is a Master’s degree program for nursing professionals who want to deepen their competencies for expert/ specialist or leadership positions and promote their career development. The competence areas are

· research, development and innovation

· clinical nursing

· pedagogy

· leadership

 

Our program follows a blended learning approach, combining online and face-to-face learning through lectures, seminars, and workshops. The program includes intensive study periods on campus in Helsinki, typically 2-4 periods in total. There are 2-5 teaching days per month, with sessions offered both during the day and in the evening.

nimi.en: Master of Health Care (UAS), Registered Nurse
Master’s Degree Programme in Advanced Practice Nursing

kuvaus.en:
The multidisciplinary online master's degree programme in Circular Economy Solutions prepares students to address global challenges related to sustainable development and to promote societal change. Graduates will master circular economy strategies and business models. They will be able to develop and lead circular economy practices in their workplaces, taking into account resource efficiency and global sustainability challenges. They will also know how to develop circular economy solutions that create value in ways that put less strain on the environment. 

The education is carried out under the guidance of experts from technology, design and business fields, and the studies include interdisciplinary teamwork. The students themselves represent diverse areas of expertise.

Applicants are required to possess at least two years of prior work experience in a related field (working full-time) and a desire to develop their professional skills in circular economy-related areas. The Circular Economy Solutions master's degree studies offer an excellent opportunity for networking and sharing expertise with your fellow students. 

Both Finnish and international students are strongly encouraged to apply. Also, applicants currently in a stage of career transition can avail of this opportunity to invest in their future skillset to help them re-enter the employment sector.

kuvaus.en:
The Master’s Degree Managing Digital Transformation in the Health Sector (ManagiDiTH) is an international online programme delivered by three higher education institutions:   

  • ISCTE - University Institute of Lisbon, Portugal (ISCTE-IUL) [ISCTE – Instituto Universitário de Lisboa]
  • Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, Greece (AUTH) [Αριστοτέλειο Πανεπιστήμιο Θεσσαλονίκης]  
  • Laurea University of Applied Sciences, Finland (LAUREA) [Laurea-ammattikorkeakoulu]  

This Master’s degree will offer multidisciplinary knowledge on how to plan and support the digitalisation of health and social care services and to promote the implementation of new procedures and services, supported by Information and Communication Technologies (ICT).

The teachers in the courses are from European Higher Education institutions, which will provide international content to study units. This will enable a multicultural and interdisciplinary learning environment by providing culturally diverse content and material.  

The ManagiDiTH Master’s programme welcomes students applying from diverse backgrounds and areas of specialisation, including healthcare, management, ICT, and other fields. 

This master's programme is designed to be completed alongside work. Teaching combines scheduled online sessions—primarily held in the afternoons or evenings—with independent coursework. While the number of online sessions is limited, students are expected to dedicate time to self-paced study, continuous mentoring, and group work. The flexible structure allows for some autonomy in planning studies, but active participation and commitment are required to progress successfully.
